review: NEED TO KNOWWhat is it? A car soccer game and superior sequel to Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars.Reviewed on i5 3230 CPU 8GM RAMPlay it on 2GHZ dual core CPU Nvidia 8800 or ATI 2900 2GB HDDAlternatively Trackmania Sensible SoccerPrice 15 / $20Release date Out now Developer PsyonixPublisher PsyonixMultiplayer YesLet s not waste energy exploring why soccer should replace its paper chain of squalid billionaires with cars and accept it as fact. A fact which Rocket League proves with simple and immediate ease.I ve never played a game that needed a tutorial less. Association football soccer wendyball whatever you want to call it it s that but on wheels. Drive car at giant ball hit ball into net score points. Rocket League s competitive core has existed for centuries and this helps make a preposterous concept feel primal. This in turn is a laughable way of describing a game which would be called moto carball if it actually existed.Like dry martinis and scribbled in an unattended notebooks Rocket League is a celebration of simplicity. Driving is delicious. Cars ease around like butter in a heated pan but always feel under your control. You accumulate boost by driving over markers on the arena floor and unleash it is a thunderous rush that fires you across over and around the pitch. Because matches take place in smooth enclosed spaces you can drive up walls and across ceilings. Cars can also jump and dodge both of which can be used defensively and offensively. The weight of the cars as well as your ability to apply unruly boost to jumps adds a pleasingly haphazard element like athletic footballers leaping to header high balls but with less shirt pulling and zero chance of flattening a 2000 hairdo.Cars ease around like butter in a heated pan but always feel under your control.Vehicles feel light and buzzy somewhere between Micro Machines and those swift slidey remote controlled cars which only seem to appear on Christmas Day. This contrasts nicely with the fat beefy bounce of the ball which gormlessly invites impact like a punchable cousin. And that s it. I feel almost guilty reducing a review to ball and car but there are only ever those two things in the field of play and crucially they both feel great. It s helped by a crisp intuitive camera. You can focus on the ball effortlessly whizzing around with it always in view or switch to the standard camera very useful for rushing back to defend your goal or smashing into other vehicles. There are no weapons but certain markers fill your boost and let you obliterate other players. Mercifully it s the generous instantly respawning type of obliteration. Destruction is the only conspicuous deviation from clean business of driving around and scoring goals but in most of the games I played it was a rarity certainly never frequent enough to be irritating.Destroying other vehicles is one of many actions which accumulates points imagine Burnout but with awards for skill not speed. You receive points for things like clearing the ball from your goal line spectacular saves and overhead bicycle kicks named so because the more literal quadracycle wheel nudge is a senseless stew of words. Giving everything a points value means it s about more than scoring goals. The most valuable players I encountered were workmanlike wingers who selflessly chugged along the the flanks crossing the ball for greedy goalhunters like me. It stops players from clustering in the same spots and reinforces the concept that Rocket League is a team game.Except of course when it s not such as when you re duelling against a single opponent. Alternatively you can set teams of four against each other in matches which become so frantic that they re less like footy more like a lost confused beach ball bashed between bumper cars. Playlists of duels doubles standard 3v3 matches and the appropriately named Chaos 4v4 mode are all available online with ranked playlists limited to duels doubles and 3v3. There s a reason why online play is the first option on the menu Rocket League is designed to be played with actual people and this is absolutely where it thrives. My experience was marvellously robust. I rarely had to wait long for a game and if players dropped out mid session they were immediately replaced by AI bots. Best of all it s refreshingly simple to get back into another game so very little time is spent lingering in lobbies.If playing online isn t your thing there are exhibition matches and full seasons you can solo. The length and difficulty can be altered and while it doesn t offer much in the way of depth cars and football remember? I still found myself bonding with pretend teammates. Whether online or offline playing games randomly unlocks new cars and upgrades. These range from simple things like fresh coats of paint and shiny wheels to pointy hats for your wizardmobile. Upgrades are purely cosmetic but volume variety and the promise of driving around with bubbles frothing from your exhaust should be enough to keep you coming back.The offline modes do reveal the game s minor inadequacies however team AI can be flaccid and unreliable especially against tougher opponents and the same simplicity which makes Rocket League immediately playable can cause things to get repetitive when played alone a criticism that only becomes apparent precisely because it s so damn addictive. It s a simple thing done brilliantly well kept interesting by the thrill of competition.
title: Rocket League®

review: What I liked about this game Great in' game dude multiplayer fun and fast paced action. Maps don't matter since they're all the same and building skill in this game is not too hard since there are always new players to grow with. Matchmaking has it's flaws but it does it's job right. Everyone has a role they have to fill out as this is a team based game. Rarely any toxic players in my experience. What I think this game can improve on A few glitches but out of all the hours I've played I've only seen one that hurt my gameplay my HUD just dissapeared out of nowhere other than that everything's alright. Most of the problems I have are with players since a lot of them are ball hogs who just run for the ball and think that just hitting it would make them win players who leave before they lose as well. Ah well no games are safe from these kinds of people. Overall Fun if you have friends. It's pretty okay without friends as well just hope you get matched with the good parts of the community. 10/10 Footnotes 05.08.18 As of lately the servers feel like constant lag and all that stuff. Nothing too bad but can get extremely annoying at times.
title: Rocket League®

review: I've been playing this game off and on for years and I can say that it's awesome. I convinced a few of my buddies to pick the game up when it first came out and honestly it was some of the most fun I've ever had with a video game messing around with them in custom games. Years later now I still play the ranked mode with one of them and we still love it. This comes from the games easy to learn but HARD to master mechanics that are overall extremely solid. I have about 200 hours now and it feels amazing controlling my car though I still have a lot to master. There is lots of capacity for hilarious and silly things to happen for beginners and awesome stunts to pull off for experienced players. The music is perfect and pairs well with the bright and colorful art style of the game which is beautiful and makes customizing your car and making it your own very satisfying because there are so many options. Frequent updates and content additions top it off as a great example of how to be a great developer. An absolutley awesome value for $20 and I can recommend this game to literally anyone.
title: Rocket League®

review: I definitely recommend this game. The gameplay never gets old and as others said it's easy to learn but hard to master. Also playing with friends is so fun. The graphics are great Psyonix clearly cares for the game and it's really addicting.The only downside in my opinion are the toxic people (compared to other multiplayer games people are actually really nice here). Also I wish you could be able to get more items by just playing for long enough instead of paying for crates and keys. The servers can also be laggy sometimes but it honestly happens rarely.In conclusion this game is definitely worth its price.

review: This game is ridiculously addicting. I've lost plenty of sleep playing it. It's the perfect game if you want to just pick it up and play for 5 10 minutes or for the whole night. The choice of being able to play with random players AI or with friends makes the game play interesting in many ways. This game is great to play with a keyboard or a controller. I highly recommend you to use a controller due to the fine control ability but if you use a keyboard that doesn't mean you are useless in the game.One downside of the game is the 8 person max to a party. I wish you could have more than 8 people to join a party. 8 people play and the rest spectates. This is pretty much my only gripe with the game. But overall it's nearly a perfect game for me in my eyes and I highly recommend it.

review: You already know what to expect if you're reading this. It's another freaking Rocket League I absolutely love playing this game. it's fun. I love how my cars looks and how bright and vibrant the game can be gameplay is fair simple and easy to learn/ master after a few games if anyone new is reading this just keep playing your skill will increase as you go obviously. I'm usually diamond but i can never keep my rank because I don't have a mic and use text chat. which leads to me getting BANNED because the community is filled with people who honestly don't know what a god damn swear word is. I swear towards my teammate who is my friend(I never play with randoms unless I'm warming up) then the next day I play it says I have been BANNED for OFFENSIVE LANGUAGE??? I don't understand how having a good time with your friend offends others. maybe I should just use team chat and not share my excitement. the reporting system in this game is too strict and doesn't make it fun for me whatsoever. I don't even think I deserve to be banned this many times (about my 97th time so far) just for this very specific reason. I would recommend this game if you're into winning LMAO only because this game had probably one of the most satisfying feeling once than and even better feeling when you win. but once again if you swear a lot in text chat let this be a warning to you. stop swearing. you'll thank me later since all the nine year olds who play this think your swears are as equivalent to them getting punched in the face by their parent or whatever. k pce

review: This game is the game. Let's start with the review.So why is Rocket League good? Is it good because it's about cars and soccer?No I mean yes but we'll get there. The game is about winning matche and "get competitive" against other players.But that's not all about it. You choose a car from the beginning (well you'll have some cars already unlocked) and that car will be pretty basic at the start of the game and when you'll start getting points and advancing levels you'll start to have more customizable options about the car for example you can put an hat that you unlocked on it and stuff like that.With those ideas in mind you'll dive into your first match of Rocket League what to expect?You won't be scoring many goals in the beginning and you aren't going to make such a difference in your team (like me for example) but as you start playing more and more you'll get the feel for the game and you'll play the game better day by day. After you played for like one week with your keyboard I hope you've already switched to a controller because playing with it it's much smoother. You'll start doing aerials (these are what flying goals are called) goals in every way possible and then you will feel like a pro.Then you will do ranked and you will win those matches and you'll feel happy. You'll have the funniest moments in your life with this trust me it's a gem!
title: Rocket League®

review: Nearly 300 hours played and I keep coming back for more.I was never a person for sports but when you are a part of the sport it's a completely different feeling. I've spent countless times trying to improve my skills and working with the teams that I get put in but I always find myself keep coming back for more.For $20 or even a sale the game is well worth the money and time well spent.Gameplay Expect to suck immediately but that's entirely okay!By the time I reached 80 hours I felt that I had become an okay player and made an okay match with most of my friends.Around the 200 hour mark I started to finally get aerials down on keyboard and mouse.Nearing the 300 and i'm flipping like crazyThe Crates and decryptors The game might seem like a P2W cars having different attributes but only by small amounts.As long as you're getting crates and play while seasonal events happen you can get decryptors to unlock new items instead of paying your way there. Most of what you get in the crates are entirely cosmetic though with some exclusions.Buy it it will likely be one of those games you come back to time from time but your mileage may vary.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is exactly what it sounds like... mostly. League! Sports! Rocket! Fast! It's fun. Good fast and enjoyable.Plethora of modes available (1v1 2v2 3v3 'Chaos' 4v4 and ranked variants of the first 3 formats IN ADDITION to some rotated 'special' playlists) a whole lot of customisation (purely aesthetic though some cars have larger/smaller hitboxes and varying turning circles).It's a pretty game and beautiful in its simplicity. Hit the ball don't let the ball get hit into your goal and try and be a nuisance to the other team in either a defensive or offensive capacity.There is a chat system in game voice and text with a variety of pre written responses but PC cannot communicate with PS4 players (outside of the aforementioned preset phrases) and as a result this produces some of the most sarcastic trash talk you will see. Botch a save? Be prepared for a spam of 'What a save!'.Rocket League is in a nutshell 'wtf how did that work' the videogame. Thoroughly recommended. Great with friends great solo. Controller is strongly recommended though it is playable with a mouse and keyboard.
title: Rocket League®

review: I have played this game for some hours now and i have to say it is very much what you would expect from the game just by reading or looking at trailers. Although it might seem like a game you would play for a couple of hours and then find it repedetive and it might be for some people but honestly im not bored of it and it might be the same thing but there is many things that are challenging to both learn and discover. Some things could be annoying at the biggining but its easy to learn.When i started out and played it for the first time i played with a keyboard and mouse and it is very difficult and takes alot of practice. Personally i use a controller and it is easier to play and manuever the car aswell.If you really want to get in to the game and play it farely well in the beggining i would recommend using a controller to 100%There are some things that could be added for example a race game mode or a mode without a ball or a puck.I really recommend the game and price whise it is a good price for the content youre getting.

review: When it first launched I wasn't really interested because the game looked simple. I bought it on a whim because of the good reviews. Rocket league is bar World of Warcraft probably one of the game's I have gotten the most enjoyment out of.The concept is simple but the skill ceiling is astronomical. However the (ranked) matchmaking is spot on in 9 out of 10 games giving you ample room to grow at your own pace.Controller is definitely recommended but me (controller) and my 2v2 partner (mouse &amp keyboard) play about the same skill level. Controller definitely gives you an edge in the air tough.Latency is rarely if ever an issue and matchmaking is fast.

review: In my opinion this game is fun.But when it comes to the competetive games it is really bad.What I don't like in this competitive system is that they always have to reset your rank for a new season. I don't care about my rank by the way I just want to have some FUN. And I can only have fun when I play with/against people that are my skill level. Not to easy and not to hard.I think that a good competetive system helps you to play against players in your skill level in order for you to get better step by step.But when they reset the ranks all the time you most likely you see a guy who has these champion wheels equipped and you prospect/challenger scrub just think yourself "well GG I will lose that one too" and then he will just wreck your team 7 1.This disorders everyplayers rank with their own skill level and you will never have players everytime in your skill level for you to be better and have the most fun.And after months when it slowly starts to be in order again they just start reseting it again just to give you a new fancy decal or some other crap.I really disagree that they always have to reset your rank for a new season and I hope that they stop doing that in order to be a better competetive system that helps you to get better and have the most fun.
title: Rocket League®

review: Yo ok so here's the scoopWhen I was... 12 13 I played this game a garbage ton on my PS4 along with some other games but I played this game the most. I was really good at this game but then my PS4 membership ran out and I couldn't get a new one so I stopped playing. It wasn't til recently that I got it on PC and started playing it again but it wasn't as fun anymore so once again I didn't play it and instead I played Overwatch. I loved Overwatch so much but my friends stopped playing it and started playing Rocket League. I eventually stopped playing Overwatch for some time and wanted to give Rocket League a try again. When I started playing again I was trash and I didn't want to play but I kept going and now I'm slowly getting better! I love Rocket League now and it's honestly so fun to mess around with my friends and rek sum scruba dub lords. I find myself playing Rocket League a lot more than I do most of my games so this is a game I highly recommend playing!

review: General Rating E (Everyone)Price $19.99Genre Sports/CompetitiveTime Played 520 hours (PC) 500 to 1000 (PS4)This game is soccer with rocket cars. You can drive on the ceiling and walls. The whole point is to get the ball into the other teams goal by any means necessary. This can be done in single player vs A.I. bots local multiplayer with friends/enemies or online multiplayer. Gameplay 10 Rocket League is a competitive sports game. Your team versus another team the team can be 1 to 4 players. Matches are 5 minutes long though you can change it in the Mutator settings to make the match last up to 10 minutes. The game is easy to start playing and with only 5 minute matches it s easy to play a few games if you don t have much time.There s a training menu to teach the basics and customized training that other players or the people from Rocket League have created that will help with the advanced mechanics.You can unlock a plethora of accessories and items for your cars. None affect gameplay they just let you customize your car. There are crates that cost money to open. However there is an option to trade for items you want as well. Story N/AThere s not a story you can play a season mode and take your team to victory against A.I. bots. The game doesn t need a story. Graphics 9 Not a complex game at first glance but the graphics are pretty solid. When you demo another car you can see the smoke and explosion from that. The various trails goal explosions rocket boosts and accessories for your cars are a nice treat to allow customization to your vehicles. Cinematics N/ANone. Controls 9(Controller)You have the option of playing with keyboard and mouse or controller. I used the controller because it felt more natural any of the keys can be remapped to allow more control. In the options menu you can change various settings that affect the camera the vibration and the controller deadzone and sensitivity. I played with the default settings and haven t changed them as of yet. I tried the controls on keyboard once. I wouldn t recommend it. Replayability/Repeatability 9With matches only taking 5 minutes you re able to play games pretty often. Only have a few minutes? You could get in 1 or 2 matches easily. Online play can take a few moments longer depending on what you re playing and how many people are online playing that specific type of match. Music 8.5Most of the music is electronic/dubstep it s not bad and due to playing the game so much i ve started listening to more dubstep. However this is just the menu music. In game usually there isn t much music besides the cheering of the crowds and the sound of the various rocket boosts as people speed towards the ball. There s several tracks in the game but you won t spent too much time in the menu unless you re customizing your car in the garage. Edit There s now an option to listen to the music while playing the game. Which I ve turned on and love. Difficulty ???Difficulty is hard to judge in this game. When starting out the A.I. on easy might seem difficult to you but if you put them on Pro or Unfair things can get a little hairy. After a time the bots seem rather stupid and unable to challenge you. Move on to the online multiplayer in the causal mode you ll play against people from all the various rankings. In the league/ranked mode you ll be matched up against people who are close to your skill level well sometimes.Driving the car isn t difficult but knowing how much speed to use and the angle to score can take a bit to get used to boosting around at full speed isn t always the answer. Then there s also the various game modes that present their own challenges. Solo Duel is different than playing Doubles which are both different from playing the Standard 3v3. And Chaos 4v4 forget it. Then there s some of the mechanics like the Aerial and shooting from the walls or ceilings. The game doesn t really pace those or introduce them. There are training exercises and they have added in the ability for people to create their own training exercises. I haven t tried any of them so I can t say one way or another if they are any good. Multiplayer 7.5The multiplayer is either local or online play. All modes are available on or offline although I think some of the rocket labs stuff has to be played online. Like any competitive game you ve got toxic players you also have friendly players. With the quick chat features people can easily spam various phrases sometimes sarcastic sometimes not. There is an option to disable chats from anyone and voice chat or to disable just the other team. This is a helpful feature as the community can be pretty toxic especially if you mess up something someone else considers easy . Very few people (in my experience) offer help or advice for newer players. Mostly derogatory comments about the play or lack of a play. Note this was mostly in Casual play. While playing the ranked matches there was still some hate/derision there but usually not as much. Now with that being said the only place to really challenge yourself is in online multiplayer. Yes you ll meet some toxic people but again it s just part of online gaming. Ignore the haters learn what you can and practice practice practice. Soma Says Frustration.. How the hell are people getting these aerial goals? How are they so much faster than me what am I doing wrong? Skip forward a year. Hate mail coming in after each match. People get very angry when losing. There is nothing quite like hitting Platinum at the end of your 10 ranking matches! Such a great feeling. However I ended at Gold 3 and didn t get the Platinum rewards. (I definitely recommend this game. Just remember no one is great the first time they play. It takes lots and lots of practice.

review: Rocket League is the perfect multiplayer game. Regardless of which platform you play it on it's fantastic. I picked it up for free on my PS4 but decided to buy it at full price on Steam when my brother did. I have to play with the graphics on their lowest settings and even though it looks like a silly cartoon version compared to normal it still plays extremely well.Using a controller is the easiest way to play though that's simply my opinion. It definitely takes some practice to understand how your vehicle moves and teamwork is a huge aspect of the game if you're in it to win it. Still it's very possible to have a good time in online games by yourself whether you're playing 1v1 or team games.Overall it plays well the controls make sense and you'll find yourself occasionally cheering as a teammate gets that goal or makes that epic save.10/10 better than FIFA!

review: I try to be briefly.Past three month I searched for all kind of coop split screen games to play it with my gf. Probably checked several hundred games. She was not a gamer so I had to find something catchy. And as you probably noticed I said she WAS not a gamer. Once we tried this game I knew that this car rocket race soccer flying game gonna kill bunch of hours from our lives. What can I say #no regret.The best way to describe the game easy to learn hard to master. And that sum ups everything you need to know before buying the game. It's easy to jump in the game and start enjoying it from the very beginning. When time goes by you will see that your skills are getting better and better. Even after few hours of gameplay you will notice how lame you were at the beginning. But then you will go to Youtube and watch some pros playing. And only then you will understand how lame you are. And probably that's why this game drives so much (pun intended). The endless possibilities of improving.Wow I could go more and more. But there is no time for long reviews when the game is waiting for me. To put it simply it's the most competitive balanced game I've ever played. And especially if you have friends to play with (on PS Xbox or PC) this is the game. Trust me I'm a doctor.

review: Downloaded the free trial and ended up buying the game.A quick pick me up game that also has depth and room for improvment. In the begining it seems almost impossible to make a goal as the game is wayyyy harder than it appears but after a while you get used to the controls and pretty soon youre doing aerial front flips shots like its nothing. Graphics 9Though a arcade like game the graphics are pretty nice and gloomy.The paint glistens and the grass looks realisticSound 9From ball sounds to the boom! that you hear when you blow up your advesary Sound seems well polished along with a pretty decent soundtrackGameplay 9Blowing up foes and barrel roll goals feel so rewarding and addictive. Realistic ball physics help set up amazing shots. Difficult at times but never to the point where you want to quit. Such a rewarding gameOverall 9 You'll get on for a few games and end up playing for hours on end. A great game to play with friends or alone. From friendly games against/with friends to fun ranked play. Rocket league is a must add to any steam owners game list. I mean combining soccer and RC cars? What a genius idea for a game right!?

review: Rocket League is a very good game especially with friends on LAN or online.What's Rocket League? It very simple you toss in your blender a bunch of toy cars and a soccer ball and you turn it ON!So yes you will play soccer while driving your favorite car and make it fly jump and even power attack to score the winning goal!!You can play symetric or asymetric games from 1v1 to the crazy 4v4.The graphics are really nice and even if in game it is not your priority you will love them since they are back up by the fact that you can custom your car.Custom your car like a kind of GTA V or Need for Speed (Underground) gives a unlimited lifetime to the game with the crates the loots and the trade system.It has multiple levels of skills required to reach the top in the competitive league.I'm not a talented player (I'm a small Silver ranked and I don't play that much!)The only downside of Rocket League is probably the frustration it can create if you play in competitive league and you have a "ok connection". I play few games (L4D2 GR WildLands GTA V...) and I have to admit it Rocket League is the less forgiving with your connection especially wifi. Be wired with fiber optic if you want to reach the top of the competitive league!!Bottom line GO GET IT! It will be fun it will be hard it will be trilling! JUST GO GET IT!

review: Rocket League Rocket cars + Soccer ball fun!What can you expect from this game? Explosions and flying cars and everyone is trying to push the sacred enormous pokeball into the force field to watch it explode. The gameplay is balanced.The mechanics is great the control is smooth even on keyboard and mouse and the graphic is amazing.A situational game 3v3 4v4 objective is to score the most goals.What i love the most about this game? Oh boy the skins you can change the color spray some art change the wheels design place some hats hang some flags. Personalize your vehicle I expect the DEV to create more skins! What can be improved?5v5? Bigger map maybe? Unfortunately the lag is something I cannot stand everyone is suddenly teleporting ball goes missing lose position. I understand it happens with online game but it is too often for me. Maybe it is my location I am in South East Asia Singapore and maybe if they fix their servers I will definitely buy their game.The big question!It is worth it to buy this game? Yes it will bring you hours of epic fun with friends!

review: This game's learning curve is absolutely impressive it is my favourite competitive game. But the game is not necessarily competitive anyone can pick it up and enjoy it casually for hours. Sadly a controller is almost mandatory to play for newcomers but some long time players also manage/are better with a keyboard. So I highly recommend picking up a controller for this title and I am sure you won't regret your purchase!
title: Rocket League®

review: Even though there are a few problems with the game (main ones being the servers and the community) I find myself playing this game for hours each day. The thing I like most about this game is that Psyonix (the game's creator) has taken an idea so simple and has made it so great. In this game you can do almost anything given enough time. Tired of just hitting the ball into the goal? Try something like dribbling aerials etc. There's so many things you can do in this game! At the start it may be hard to get a grasp of but once you get the hang of it you most likely won't let go. This game is one of the most fun games that i've ever played and hopefully it will be one of yours too.

review: 8/10.Good graphics. Very unique gameplay though nothing about the mechanics has changed since release (would've like a few minor tweaks). Awesome to play with friends and awesome to play alone.Ever since it got large enough (like CoD CS GO or any game that's blown up and gone "pro") the community surrounding it grew weak and whiney. The chat police was a big draw back. I miss being able to call people cuck s all the time. I even enjoyed being called autistic and gay.Put a lot of time into it before it blew up huge. I loved just about every minute and I wouldn't take it back. I hope others do as well. Just be careful though cuz the kiddie gamers will rat on you very very quickly.

review: First of all... I LOVE this game.I started playing when you could download it for free on the Playstation 4. I immediately fell in love with this game. I had about a thousand or so hours on it on Playstation 4 before I started playing on PC. If you like football and you like cars start playing Rocket League. Psyonix is one of the smaller companies but sure has grown a lot in the last couple of years due to the amazing work they put into this game. As a player in this game you can constantly improve. People keep on coming up with new methods to use. Rocket League is definetely one of those games where you get better by practicing A LOT. If you put the time into practicing you will definetely see a difference in your gameplay and your overall skill. Sure Rocket League has its flaws but what game doesn't? I admit I don't really like the ranking system in this game. But its doable for me. And thats just my opinion ofcourse. Rocket League is only 20 I find this perfect since thats all you have to pay for. Sure you can buy keys cars and crates (Christmas crates Halloween crates) using real life money. But you don't need those to properly play this game. So its a one time purchase.Also I do recommend to play this game with a controller. I have used keyboard and abselutely suck with it. I hate the controls and if I change them I still don't like the way keyboard and mouse work on Rocket League. One of the main reasons is I played on PS4 for a long time so I am used to a controller. But this is just my personal opinion ofcourse if you like playing with mouse and keyboard im not saying you shouldnt do it. I just think its easier with a controller.Overall I think Rocket League is an AMAZING game and I recommend it to everyone!
title: Rocket League®

I have a really good internet connection (ping is about 20 30ms) and somehow I manage to go through the ball many times in a row. Asked my teammates if they were seeing the same thing on their screens and they were (tl dr everyone in 3 different games saw me go through the ball whilst trying to hit it multiple times).I would give this game a 8/10 Great would be perfect if it actually had updates that mean something other than just adding a new crate or fixing 2 3 bugs.

review: Honestly this game deserves 5 stars but it's point system is terrible. It doesn't accurately describe how a person is doing. Like if you give your team mate an open net shot but you had to dribble two people to pass to them they get 110 points 100 for scoring 10 for a shot and then you get 50 points for assist and sometimes 20 points for centering. It either needs to be broadcasted to people that the point system doesn't exactly determine skill or the point system has to be reworked. But the gameplay in the game is great I have like 1000 games in (most of my time is because i left it on for weeks on end on vacations or something) and my only problem is people being too egotistical but that happens in any game once you hit a certain point

review: I honestly love this game it's a great way to be a to your friends and (hopefully) not loose the friendship because of it. Crates don't completely scam you so you get actually decent stuff in the crates. The Learning Curve of this game is really steep and you'll always be learning new things to improve but the beginning curve is steep. If you played SARPBC then you should be fine. Its a beautiful game with graphics that even on the lowest settings still make it look decent and it doesn't lag. It's really hard to get decals and such at first but I think that with the Rocket Pass that comes out tomorrow (which btw I'm so excited for) that it will fix that problem and allow some of the newer players who can't buy keys and such to get someone decent decals with the Dycrptors. Overall the game is amazing and if you're starting out I'd buy a Rocket League tutor to help you out.

review: When Rocket League first came out I downloaded it for FREE on the Playstation store. Years later it's one of the most popular online competitive games out there. Play two on two or three vs three. You have a vehicle and you basically play soccer but with cars. It's a fun game with newly added game modes and a competitive mode which shows your rank and skills. You can customize your favorite car with new wheels paint job turbo colors and a lot more!!! Since Rocket League is so popular they have teamed up with multiple companies to deliver you some very cool cars like the three Batmobiles they have due to the partnership with DC Comics. Rocket League is an arcade style pick up and play fun game all around. Great online multiplayer game.

review: Sometimes the most absurd ideas beget the most remarkable results.Rocket League is one such instance of that. It's fun if you have no idea what you're doing and are just trying to hit the ball it's fun if you're a seasoned pro and know just how to angle and position your car to get that badass aerial goal and it's fun if you're somewhere in between. I'm a bit disappointed with the introduction of the crates (Do not buy them they are a waste of money!) but I can look past those and still call this an amazing game. Just... buy it install it turn off the music and replace it with your own because it's bad and then enjoy! Highly recommend getting some friends to play the game with though.

Adam 500 saat oynamış hala havadan gelen en zayıf topu bile içine alıyor. Kale önünde başlayıp kick off'lardan sonra boosta koşan orospu çocuğu aynı zamanda siz 2 kişi atak yaparken en arkadan am görmüş gibi gelince rakip takımda da olsa kazanmak keyif vermiyor. Platin de dahil olmak üzere alt liglerde bir oyun diğerini tutmuyor. Aynı sorun üst liglerde de var birazcık eksiği sadece. review: Rocket League. What a ing beautiful game.Now I m sure this review will go unread due to the thousands and tens of thousands of other reviews out there but hey what can I say? Rocket League is one of the best games on the steam market to this day.Now I could go on for hours and hours and hours about how great the game is but instead I m just going to simply explain that this game is beautiful and will never get boring no matter how much you play. That s the thing about Rocket League. At this point I ve logged about 105 hours and I still haven t gotten bored of this game. I constantly play online with friends or in offline season mode which is a great addition to the game. And if you get really bored of the gameplay mechanics (which you shouldn t) consider making your own gamemode under the exhibition tab. This game is great and overall I would rate it 10/10 just like a hundred thousand other people would.

review: Short review +Simple satisfying and hard to master gameplay+Great artstyle and graphics+Amazing community+Original concept+Supports cross platform and 4 player splitscreen+Competititve capabilities Hard for players with lesser computers to play multiplayer matchesLong review This game is great to start off. I love the kinda futuristic artstyle great performance and extremely satisfying gameplay. The concept is great and a fresh look on multiplayer sports type games. One of my favorite things about Rocket League was the fact that it was really easy to pick up but took time to master. I do not like it when games seem somewhat intimidating to players by throwing a bunch of mechanics options and gameplay elements around to the point where you have no idea what to do when you start out. You can also customize your car in this game and I think other games should take notes the customization in this game is phenominal. There is none of that customization DLC t you unlock everything just by playing the game. You earn one customization item per round to be specific. However even after say 100 hours you will still not have everything unlocked as there are just so many items to get. I would like to see the devs add a trading system to trade items I think that would be cool.The community is great. Unlike a lot of games with competitive capabilities you never see anyone harassing you for not being perfect at the game. There is a massive amount of people who love to play the game both casually and competitively. Rocket League also supports cross platform gameplay so say goodbye to not being able to find a match. Plus 4 player splitscreen. I did have a couple of issues though. The game has a system where if you do not load into a match in under somewhere around 15 seconds you were automatically timed out. This isolates a lot of people who do not have as powerful of computers. Also the game is pretty much exactly the same as its predecessor SARPBC. They really should have called this a remaster not a sequel.EDIT Wow. The day I write this review and say there is no DLC customizations they add some.

review: I do not like games about sports. I do not like games about cars. I love this game.If you look and see I don't have many hours on this game it's because I hardly played it up until now. I recieved it as a gift from a friend and I thought I wouldn't like it a whole lote because it is about sports. I played a match got off and never touched it again. Until now. I got back on to play with the same friend a couple days ago and I have been much more active now. It has quickly become one of my favorite games even though I have many more hours in G Mod or Terraria and I would definitely recommend this to anyone.Although this has been mostly an opinion so far. I should actually tell you about the game in case you are choosing whether or not to buy it. Let's go over the positives first. There is plenty of customization from the paint on your car to the explosion that happens when you make a goal. Oh yeah by the way when you make a goal there is an explosion. The default controls are good and you can really feel the movement of your vehicle. There are lots of different modes to choose from and you can trade items with your friends! Don't like your hat but your friend doesn't like theirs either? Trade the hats/antenna/literally anything. You can also turn in 5 of the common items you have earned to get a better rarer item. You receive an item after every match. (Or at least I think you do.) The music is great. The menus are easy to navigate. The graphics are good. There are lots of cars. There are lots of maps. Lots and lots of good things!But there are also bad things. Sometimes you get connection issues. People are toxic pretty often and will often try to steal your goal (Not all the time though.) This next part is usually an honest mistake but people tend to hit it in to their own goal often. Great when the enemies do it. Not so much when your team does it. Rare items are rare therefore hard to find unless of course you spend money on keys for crates and buy yourself some shiny exotic items. Items do not help you play however they just give you bragging rights to having the coolest car.That is basically it. Great game. You don't have to like sports or cars to like this game. Go buy it and have some fun! )

review: Well this game absolutely amazing. Really. When i bought the game i really didn't know what to expect. A friend of mine recommended it to me and i checked it out. I saw it and thought that i should buy it. I really hoped the community was great. And it certainly was. Very nice people. Not too many Russians. No hackers. I started playing it and in the beginning it was really hard to even get close to the ball. Everything just goes so quick. But practice makes perfect. For as long as I played this game now i haven't found a single bug. The graphics are not too bad just all looking totally fine. The price $20 not too expencive and totally worth it. Really. Than your pc requirements. Your pc doesn't has to be high end just medium is good enough. I think there is no limit in playtime. I think you can keep getting better and wreck the whole community skill level. Now about you. You. Are you good enough for it? Are you good enough to beat the community. Yes? Go check it out. No story as you probably expected. Overall Good game nice graphics fair price unlimited playtime. Do I recommend this? Yeah I do.

review: Code of Conduct and Banning PolicyOriginal post http //www.rocketleaguegame.com/news/2016/09/code conduct banning policy/It s been a huge week for Rocket League and our community! We ve rolled out our free Rumble update www.rocketleaguegame.com released Rocket League on Mac and SteamOS introduced a brand new Crates and Keys system and taken additional steps to ensure that you get the best possible experience on all supported platforms.It s with those new features and added content in mind that we ve decided to post these updated player behavior guidelines and our policies surrounding them NO HARASSMENT TROLLING OR OTHER JERK BEHAVIORWe don t like toxic players and neither does our community. If someone out there targets you with abusive language makes threats or does any of the other bad things we ve listed in our EULA www.rocketleaguegame.com or Terms of Service www.rocketleaguegame.com then it s a bannable offense. We aren t going to ban someone for using a Quick Chat sarcastically but using racist sexist or otherwise hateful language is grounds for a ban.To help us ensure that disruptive players are dealt with appropriately please remember to use our Mute/ Report Player feature that allows you to block communications from someone who is bothering you and/ or report them to our team. We revised the in game UI so that player bans are more obvious to the individuals receiving them in the Rumble update. We believe that this small but important change will serve as a more effective deterrent going forward.SELLING IN GAME ITEMS IS NOT PERMITTEDNow that Crates and Keys are out in the wild many of you have been spending a lot of time trading with your friends. Trading is a fantastic way to complete collections in Rocket League be it for Toppers Antennas or Decals but it s important to remember the rules that come along with it.Outside trading puts you at risk for scams and other illegal activity which is why trying to sell in game items outside of Rocket League is against our EULA www.rocketleaguegame.com or TOS www.rocketleaguegame.com . More specifically Crates Keys and other in game items may only be traded for other in game items Crates or Keys to ensure a safer and healthier ecosystemOUR BANNING POLICYEncouraging a healthy environment in Rocket League comes with enforcing our aforementioned player bans. If you re reporting another player in game you can select from among these categories Verbal Text Harassment (which includes offensive language flooding etc.)Unsportsmanlike conduct (which includes intentional disruption of the game AFK ers. etc.)Cheating (which includes smurfing opponent collusion etc.)Psyonix has a zero tolerance policy when it comes to harassment of any kind and we will ban reported offenders at our discretion. The length of player bans for any valid reason is also at our discretion and could include permanent bans if appropriate. Furthermore the more often you are banned the longer each subsequent ban will be including an eventual permanent ban.With the addition of our new Crates and Keys system it should also be noted that Crate Farming (i.e. players who join matches with no intention of playing with teammates) is not allowed because it takes away from both the flow and the action of a game. If you see someone crate farming during a match please report them under the Unsportsmanlike Conduct category and we ll take it from there.FRIENDLY REMINDERLast but not least? Be nice everyone! Rocket League is a game that brings people together from all over the world. We want our game to be a fantastic and healthy experience for everyone who enters a stadium regardless of their skill rank or experience. The nicer we are the more fun our community can have and having fun is what s all about!on my 6th 24 hour ban!!! fku!!!!

review: This is a good game if you don't take it too seriously. I'm not joking. I introduced this to my friend a couple months after release and he has been addicted ever since. It's quite ridiculous really. This game is literally tearing him apart he is actually dying on the inside. You do not understand the amount of anguish this has caused him. He has become more "toxic" and easily "tilted". The toxicity has gotten to the point where he was banned for 24 hours for "language". He has come to the point where he believes Psyonix itself is out for him. I've never seen such mental anguish appear due to "car soccer". I once joined the discord call to see three thousand gg's in the discord chat and a very worrying suicide message. I have been in the call for the whole progression of my friend's "experience" and can say that this only got worse the closer he got to Grand Champion. Some games have caused him to question his existence and others have left him so angery the Hulk himself would be scared.If you truly want to play for fun like a game should be then get it. I highly recommend. But if you want to get serious know what has happened to my friend and tread carefully.

review: This game technically is fairly good. They only problem I see is that the servers turn to absolute rubbsih at peak times during the week you will most likely not be able to find a smooth game Monday through Friday from about 3pm to 10pm. However this game is not what you think it is. It is played off as being a competitive fun game it is evertything but that. If you are playing with friends then you are good but competitive might as well be a roll of a dice to decide if you win the game. My advice is either buy the game knowing that 50% is up to luck either your side or the oponents or play just with friends and not any compeitive game modes because they are truely a 100% waste of time. I cant stress enough why they should take the word "competitive" out of the "competitive playlist" because it is honestly just who ever can hit the ball second.

review: Very good game!I see it as a game just for entertainment but it can also be a game where you test your skills. Starting off the game is very easy to learn but extremely hard to master. review: I was looking for a fun multiplayer game at winter sale and i decided to buy Rocket League. At first i thought it's not that hard to play this game and then i realized it's pretty hard. It has some technique which are not easy to learn and take a great amount of time to master.I think is the dark souls of mp games especially for keyboard user like me.Some people said it's better to play this game with a controller but i'm natural keyboard user. Finally after some hours i got a pretty good grip at this game. Even though i'm still very bad. One game is around 5 minutes long so it's good for short time break and isn't a time killer game. Unless you click that play button again and again XD Overall it's really really fun as long as you don't care about competitive. Enjoy wrecking enemy car mash the keyboard for that one goal and mess up XD 11/10

review: EDIT Years later I still can't listen to the music while playing the game / It only plays in the menu.This game is 2 things hard and fun although I would make the argument that it's only hard because the controls are weird. It definitively takes some getting used to re binding keys until you are comfy with all of them (defaults suck). You really should do some goalie or striker training in addition to the tutorials before you go online.Customizations on cars are nice keeps you playing even when you get frustrated.My only wish is that there was some variety to the layout of the maps instead of just re skins of the same map.EDIT Well a year later we got maps with new layouts and gamemodes with crazy powerups. Looks like the devs know what's up.
title: Rocket League®

review: As someone who hates sports games and racing games someone whose competitiveness far outstrips his skill and someone who finds losing and failure quite distasteful I have to say that I am pretty mediocre at Rocket League. And I still love the game regardless.I honestly can't even begin to identify why Rocket League is so fun. The concept of playing soccer with rocket powered cars is simply genius but I think the secret sauce is how Psyonix has polished everything to museum quality. The controls art style menus sounds network code are all expertly crafted to seamlessly guide you to the fun at the games core. Rocket League is a good idea executed flawlessly.

review: 10/10. This game is constantly updated with new content and is incredibly fun. It's very addicting and unique. On the surface it looks a lot like soccer but with cars when in reality it acts like an entirely new sport. Go it alone or with friends in both competitive and casual this game promises a lot of fun. If you'rer up to it there's even a crate system which you can access completely free and through trading even if you aren't lucky yourself you can eventually trade to something you really want. If you're not up to it you can still make your car look cool without using crates. There's tons of items to choose from. It's really fun to improve your skills while playing rocket league and it's just an all round amazing game with easter eggs hidden around everywhere. Rocket League is truly a work of art Psyonix really outdid theirselves making this game.
title: Rocket League®

review: If you are looking for a game you can only get better at and if you want to drive super sonic acrobatic rocket powered battle cars then this is the game for you. I have played over 700 hours and I can say I still have a lot to learn and I have fun doing it. There is a competitive side to the game if you want to get serious with the game or you can collect all the hats in the game and wear your pidgeon topper with pride. but I seriously would recommend this game to anyone who wants to have fun. It is difficult at first and you wont like it if you don't stick with it and practice but once you hit your first arial goal it really shows how your practice has paid off and you feel good. 10/10 would buy again
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a game I feel like I'm not allowed to dislike. Rocket League is a game equivalent of an abusive spouse. "I've spent so much time with you I can't imagine being with anyone else" Then boom you get dunked on in your last Diamond reward placement match and suddenly all the hours you've put in so far become torture instead of fun.However the next day you come back and you're back to enjoying it again before the vicious cycle repeats itself. I'm not even a very competative person by nature and I still absolutely love doing comp matches in this game. Again I almost want to dislike this game but I just can't do it. You get mad at your own lack of skill you get mad at everyone else being better than you (They obviously don't try as hard as you why should they deserve to win?) But still there's something great about this game that just refuses to go away. Maybe it's just how good it feels to pull of a good goal or a nutty save knowing you did it by your own skill alone (Unless the other team does then it's luck). Maybe it's the visable and very real progression from going up ranks. Hey maybe it's just being able to make other people amazingly angry from nothing more than having an anime girl profile picture. I don't know what it is but I can't stop loving this game despite absolutely hating it.
title: Rocket League®

review: Alright here is why you should pick up Rocket League.Firstly we have the customization I do disagree with the lootbox system but the point is it's only cosmetics. Unless you have money to burn opening crates is very unnecessary.Secondly we have the community. When starting new you will suck learning the game (unless your a God). People will leave and talk trash but everyone starts somewhere they also forget that the mode thats probably being played is casual. Unless its ranked what they say DOES NOT matter. Although when your a new player why would you play competitive in the first placeNext is "PC SPECS???" Okay this game might be intimidating to run on low end hardware BUT if your alright "rough" graphics its no problem. On an Intel hd 410 I got 30fps on all low settings but going into the game code (Check out the Low Spec Gamers video on lowering internal resolution) i lowered internal resolution to around 40% and I got a fairly consistent 60fps.Next is Online presence. This game has a healthy amount of players (unlike speedrunners Sorry) although in casual I find most players playing for "soccar" so finding people to play other modes may be an issue.Next is STRATEGY. Suprisingly this game has alot of depth in strategies and as time goes by strategies will improve.

review: Growing up my brothers and I would play various sports titles for soccer hockey basketball and football can't even remember their names (I know FIFA though!) haha but mostly loved screwing around like trying to hit the refs with the hockey puck. Outside of doing dumb stuff I never really enjoyed the sports games because the mechanics just felt clunky and not inherently fun especially as I never enjoyed sports IRL. Rocket League though... It's like the sports game for people who don't like sports games or even IRL sports. My brothers and I now in our 20's don't even care about winning. The game itself is just so dang fun to play and it's the perfect example of a game that's easy to learn and hard to master. And learning to master the game (i.e flying through the air to score sick goals and manage epic saves) is INCREDIBLY fun but its absolutely not necessary to enjoy the game. Want casual play?** play unranked and turn off chat check out some of the arcade y game modes (like "hoops" a basketball esque twist) Want that good ol' LAN party feel? grab some controllers and play splitscreen and/or invite friends to play online Love the thrill of domination? climb the ranked ladder and bust your butt in the official training modes and community made Workshop trainers E sports? Find Rocket League on Twitch and realize just how unimaginably insane the game gets at the highest skill levels Love collecting items? Or spending hours designing your character with unlocked loot? you can win one or more cosmetics at the end of nearly every game win or lose ranked or unranked! Unlock special cosmetics for climbing the ranked ladder! Browse a variety of free out of the box cars paint textures and various ornaments! Also lootboxes DLC and more!**I should note that apparently a lot of other people playing the game get really salty tilted and toxic. Are they the majority? I don't know because I turn off all chat from the enemy team and only play with friends/family on my team. If you want to just enjoy the game turn off enemy (and even allied if you want) chat and just have fun.
title: Rocket League®

review: First of all For this game u dont need to be either a car fan nor a football fan.Gamemodes maps and many other features still get added and so do DLCs.Not only do the cars have their own looks they also function a bit differently so they can suit your playstyle.What I also personally really enjoy about this game is the car designing part having a lot of different cosmetics that you can design really cool looking cars with.Barely any glitches (at least I barely encounter them) really smooth experience except for the ball sometimes moving strangely when a lot of people interact with it at the same time but this doesnt ruin anything.Easy to learn hard to master.Also its recommended to play this with controller but you certainly dont have to. I dont use a controller myself but I hear a lot of people recommending it.Overall its just a really fun game especially with friends but even without friends its still quite enjoyable in my opinion.Definately recommended.

review: Before I start I heavily recommend this game as I have played enough to have a thorough review.When you start playing you probably will be horrible and not score many goals. Once you've played about 5 hours you'll get the hang of it. So you'll end up playing about 20 more hours and realize you can fly. Flying is really a game changer and you should probably try and learn how to do it when you have ranked up to pro (Level 20 29). Once you can fly you instantly have an advantage over other players. But what happens when other players can fly? Learn rotations of course. Learning how to stay about a half field a way from your teammates on defense and then rotating forward will also be a necessity in the game if you wish to be very good. Finally after all of this you will pear to wall hit. Personally I'm not very good at these I hit about had of them. You you look up a tutorial you can practice it from there. I have a friend who is good at them and it helps a lot in all gamemodes. In the end I recommend this game to all. It has perfect playability w place to practice and even a great community. I've actually made 3 friends in 1 hour.

review: HelloI have played the game over 600 hours and I will not give you the basic review that everyone seem to give because I am done with this game for a reason.Now I'll start off by saying that the progress system(moreso learning curve) is extremely fun and rewarding especially if you learn a bunch of stuff in normal play and then hop to competitive play and find yourself being better than your opponents.Although as much as I can go on for hours and hours about how much I LOVED the game it is completely sad that the game is turning to the way that it is.Updates in the past(played the game since basically release ish) were all about optimization getting rid of bugs and useless stuff that hurt the game and listening to the community(for example Hoops mode.) Nevertheless the devs seem to really like the amount of money that they were able to produce out of the game despite the huge amounts of sales going and the community loving it and turning into a CSGO Like every update is based around a new crate/new DLC the only new content seems to be around DLCs and more money milking from the game and it is sad to see the game going that way because it was a wonderful creation and it turned into a money milking. game similar to how many companies are ruining their games nowdays.I was very supportive of the devs and purchased many of the DLCs plus a bunch of copies to my friends to support the devs in their indie experience but it is almost disgusting to see how far they've come and how little their attention to the game and new features has gotten.Fantastic game just try your best to retain from emptying your wallet on the dumb cosmetics or you'll fall into a huge bottomless pit.Putting the review on Negative mainly to try and warn as many people as possible from getting into the DLC/In game purchases fest.
title: Rocket League®

review: I've been playing this game consistently for almost as long as it's been out. I originally played well over 1000 hours on PS4 (just a guesstimate there's no way to check on PS4). Making the switch to PC just made it that much better. Whether if you're just starting to play or you've played enough to be able to pull off ceilling shots this game is fun. You know a game is good when there's hundreds of knockoff versions of it in the App Store. This game is very much worth the price sale or no sale. Another plus is that the loot crate system is ONLY cosmetics. There's no boosts or other certain advantages. You win matches based on your personal skills.
title: Rocket League®

P(Oh and thanks for letting me trade keys on PC.)

review: I was skeptical about the $15 (now $20) pricetag for a game with essentially one gamemode. It recently had a free weekend and I tried it. Until then I had only heard glowing reviews but was still unsure about a high price for a small amount of content.Needless to say I played seven hours in two days and then bought it full price as soon as it wasn't free. I'm a stickler for one dollar one hour and I can easily see myself spending 20+ hours playing this game. The controls are damn tight the game is simple and incredibly fun to play.It might also help that the first 20ish games I played I won 7+ to 0 because apparently I'm godlike at this. And then I got matched with other godlike players and now any win I get is usually by one point.WORTH

review: This game is actually amazing. Normally when I buy games on Steam I wind up getting a refund because the games are meh. I was unsure of buying this game but then I found $20 on an old PayPal account.This game is actually one of the most incredible things ever. From the beautiful graphics to the gameplay what is there not to like? I mean come on! It's soccer and cars. It is also awesome to just progress and see yourself become better (although in my case still not particularly good) at various aspects of the game. For me it would specifically be aerials. I always thought it was pretty cool when I would watch on YouTube people playing RL and seeing them fly with their boost for extensive periods of time. Now I can do it (albeit not as well). This game is very fun especially with friends and it is worth every penny even at full price I would recommend it!

review: This game is fantasic with hundreds of hours in at this point I can say its money well spent. You start out thinking its an easy concept and a fun stupid little game then somebody does something that you didnt know was possible and you fight to learn the mechanics to pull that off and the cycle continues of learning new mechanics ranking up getting on and so on and so on.I love this game if you are competitive and like a balanced game this is for you. There are 'loot boxes' but they're all cosmetic so no items give you an unfair advantage. This game is a really good value at this point its cost me $0.02 per hour of playtime so i've definitley got my moneys worth

review: Rocket League was massive and endless fun. It is very easy get into the game even if you never used a controller before.I have 800 hours in it so why do I not recommend?I have been playing on PC since 1989 (!). Tried many many games online since the mid 90's and believe me RL have the worst community I have ever experienced. I am not playing to be the best but to have fun with friends or alone. RL is a brilliant and simple game but the tons of 9 13 years old IQless children just ruins it at least for me.Games are meant to have fun and enjoy the time you spend playing. When a game turns out not to be fun anymore you should let it go. ( Similar reason why I stopped playing CS after 11 years )I don't recommend it maybe I just got too old for this kind of "fun".Originally I bought RL to have the "couch playing" in split screen mode with my wife and father in law. That was so much fun and laugh. Even when I started to play with my steam friends turned out to be fun too. The good moral and fun started to disappear when I / we became a bit skilled and started to play against mid skilled players who were so frustrated and stressed to win. If you missed a hit you got "Nice shot!" got a goal got "What a save!" in the quick chat. Sometimes these kids went even further and explained in how they shagged your mother last night. Yeah well we all can get this in other games but my many years of experience tells that this community is the worst.The fact that the game is so simple and a 9 years old can easily jump on it and start playing brings down the level to theirs. And how can I prove it? You not gonna have the same problem in a chess community. (Yes I played competitive chess for 2 years online)Only exception when I can recommend this is when you play it with your friends only on a low skilled level. There you gonna have so much fun for sure.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a great game. It is definitely worth the 20 dollars.It takes a lot of time and practice to play well but that is sort of what follows with every game.Using a controller is best for this game though the type (Xbox/PS4) is your preference.A dislike is that you cannot filter swearing so you may occasionally meet toxic people who use foul language and you cannot block it. You can Mute/Report the player but you can't erase the chat box either.Although to do that you can disable the chat box you can't really do that in the heat of a match.Overall a great game! Great job Psyonix!

review: Rocket League is one of those games that keeps you in the edge of your seat and slamming your fists on your desk. This is one of the reasons that I also own FPS games as a backup for many rage moments. This game can be played hours at a time depending on the tolerance you have for clutch saves and across field goals (I m assume you know what Rocket League is).However as I do not have a large tolerance for closely missed saves and goal posts as I mentioned before I keep backups. I play Rocket League usually between 1 2 hour periods.But The reason I really play Rocket League is because it s a sport. You have control of the ball you make passes with teammates and you make the Amazon saves. You re not telling the player to save the ball or to shoot it s physically you controlling your car.The only issue I have is the toxicity in the community. Many people I have played with have relied purely on insulting and making the other player so off that they can t focus. I have also had people that just cuss me out for beating them and then rage quit having lost.
title: Rocket League®

Later tonight Me to teammate What a save ! What a save ! What a save ! What a save ! Start&gt Forfeit&gt Uninstall Rocket LeagueTomorrow Reinstall.

review: REVIEW #18Rocket League When it comes to sports games nothing is much flashier than soccer played with rocket powered cars. Thankfully Rocket League is much more than a game simply based on a gimmicky sounding concept. The game is a perfect balance of arcade style accessibility and simulation style strategy. Almost anyone can pick up this game and score a goal with a nitrous burning speed machine but Rocket League also allows players to learn to master it and become near unstoppable online pros.All around the game is very polished. It features excellent audio and graphics spot on controls solid online matchmaking capibilities (as well as offline play) and multiple gameplay modes including hockey and basketball variations. There's also tons of ways to customize your vehicle even allowing for two different variations of your vehicle that switch depending on which team you play on. There's also a good helping of DLC available including noteworthy options such as the Batmobile and the Delorean from Back to the Future.The only negative that I can give is that the game's AI is known for being very poor (to the point where it has been seen scoring a goal for the opposing team on rare occasions.) It does appear that the AI has been worked on and strengthened as the game has been updated but I unfortunately have no proof that this has actually occurred. However if you play online you won't be playing with the AI a great deal.Even if you don't enjoy sports games (like myself) it's still worth looking into this top notch title. It's easy to pick up and play for the first time and once you first feel the rush of scoring and claiming victory I guarantee that you'll come back for more.
title: Rocket League®

review: Almost 300 hours has provided me a pretty decent idea of what the game entails so I shall share.1. You are the operator of a vehicle. These vehicles are reminiscent of our real world cars.2. These "cars" (as I shall henceforth describe them as) also have the otherworldly ability to jump and fly via rocket capabilities (I believe this may have impacted the naming convention of the vehicle simulator)3. These cars are engaged in a sporting competition vaguely resembling soccer where the objective is to place a sphere into a rectangular receptacle. 4. Rounds are set to a 5 minute limitation unless time elapses and there is still a tied score then the game goes into "overtime" and will play until a team has scored a final and conclusive goal.My overall impressions of this game are it's fun.I like it. If you fancy a competitive sporting match where you yourself do not exert actual physical efforts and also mimics a human sport but is instead played by car like vehicles with aerial capabilities (fictional to be sure) I cannot myself think of a better title than this "Rocket League."

Matches last 5 minutes (and extra time if tied) and that makes for really frantic and intense gameplay and the match length is just right.Great graphics and excellent soundtrack!Addictive game but finding matches on peculiar times can be hard. When you do find a match it is epic! Highly recommended.
title: Rocket League®

review: First off i love this game in every physical aspect i love the concept i love the gameplay i love the cars the customisations and of course the baloon crowd. if i were to judge the game soely on its tecnical aspects 10/10 no question. BUT there are issues with the most important feature of the game multiplayer. you can rarely join a match (if you dont get in within a minute you may as well restart the game and try again) and when you do get into a match the game is loaded with people who have terrible pings causing the entire team to lag for example when we were up 2 0 they came back and won 4 2 in the last 20 seconds because we couldnt see a THING until it already happened. the replays didnt help either. just a ball randomly shooting into the goal at 120 kph while everyone was lagging across the feild. i had a ping of 30 so it was caused by someone else. intentionally done or not this was angering.i would assume private matches are better because you can control who joins but as of now none of my freinds own the game. overall this game gets an 8/10 im knocking off 2 points for all the various issues with online if those get fixed consider this a 10/10.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is the essence of skill vs skill. You've already read all the reviews about how it's basically Soccer (Futbol) with cars. Yes it is. However it's about the gameplay with this one. The finely tuned controls and percision that this game gives you to actual do whatever creative idea you have in your head is possible. Sure there is a learning curve with the percision aspect of this game however it is for the most part a small one. If you are at all into competetive games you will more than likely enjoy this game.If you enjoy doing insane stuff in games that baffle people you will more than likely enjoy this gameIf you enjoy fast paced action and destroying other people y ou will more than likely enjoy this gameIf you remember your childhood ( or are in your childhood) where everything was just fun and awesome get this game.Con I will say this as a current issue that I have with this game. As of now (8/27/2015) There is no way you can party play between the PC and PS4 version. You can play with your friends on cross play through their private game setup however it's not the same as being in a party and playing ranked or with other online players. With that said Psyonix said that they are working on a way to bridge this gap. There currently isn't any word on when that will be out yet but they did say it was indeed a sought after priority.Buy this game.
title: Rocket League®

While it is a simple and repeatitive the game still hasn't gotten old even after the 70ish hours I've put in this game at the time of writing this review. 20$ is worth it but I would probably wait for a sale if you're into having money to buy food.

review: I want to start off by saying that Rocket League is a fun game and although challenging with its steep learning curve can be a very epic experience as a whole. I haven't played for long though me and my friend being new players we had come into contact with a pretty big problem the matchmaking. This game is very foreign to us altogether so we would hope to run into players in a similar situation as us who had just bought the game and began playing to accustom themselves to the concept pace and overall feel of the game. However instead of a fair challenge we were faced with players who have clearly been playing for leagues longer than we have and we stood no chance. This happend about five or six times until we gave up out of frustration and closed the game. We feel we haven't given it a fair amount of time playing so we urge you to take this with a grain of salt. I recommend this game for its great gameplay astounding visuals novel concept and overall execution however I do not recommend it for its flaws with its matchmaking system (at least for casual). Despite the abunance of pros for this game I feel that the matchmaking issues cancel all of them out simply because you'll never be able to learn or enjoy them without either practicing on your own or entering games with those whom had just purchased the game as well. Part of me feels as though we just got an unlucky break so that's why I still tilt in favor or overall recommendation for now. I love the idea of this game though I want to be able to play it in an environment where everyone else I'm playing with is close to if not just as experienced as me. That way learning becomes easier and you don't get pelted with overkilling failure as a result of faultless inexperience.

review: Crazy fun with friends and good community with only few salty fishes gives you good chances to have decent time even by yourself. Re playability is massive. Every game has it's ''Close One!'' and ''What a Play!'' I mean where else can you drive cars into a massive ball ( or a cube) and other cars and boost your way through the skies and get praised by your teammates and be hated by your enemies. Game has quite a few DLC's and more seem to be coming but they are not necessary in any way to enjoy the game. Game is not P2W or P2P in any way which is great and a huge bonus of course. Game is also priced reasonably and atlest I can say that I think I've had (and will) my moneys worth. Definitely recommend the game for all ages. At least give it a shot with friends or by yourself. Steams refund system is perfect for this and you can almost say that you have nothing to loose. Just give it a go or a shot whatever floats your boat.
