review: Overall great game. It's the type of game that you can sit down and veg out while playing. Short 5 min matches and a causal match setting which is great if you don't feel like being super competitive while playing. It's a great game to play with friends especially if you have a discord server where you can all communicate together. Competitive play is decent but better if you have designated partners to play with instead of pairing up with random people. The game can be aggravating at times and the community of players can go from suprisingly wholesome to toxic as hell in a heartbeat but that can probably be said about any game. I will say if you want to get good at the game it takes A LOT of practice. I myself have played roughly 85 hours and i am a average player at best. The only true cons i have with the game are 1. horrible servers that constanly disconnect or fail to pair you up with an actual partner and instead give you an AI partner.2. The matchmaking system is trash. In casual play there is no "matching players up by skill or play time" rookie players with virtually no play time get matched up with seasoned veteran players who basically slaughter them. It can be annoying starting off.3. The competitive ranking system isn't much better at giving appropriate ranks or matchmaking. I could go into greater detail but im sure someone else has already covered it in a comment or video.Like I said at the beginning of this comment I do think this is a great game and I'd definitely recommend it to a friend. I'd give rocket league a 7/10.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game can only be defined as "Its all fun and games until someone gets hurt." Now this statement is correct besides the point where you can only have your ego hurt its very easy to be good and play a few quick games before school this game is what i like to call "bite sized sports" simply because you dont need the dedication of 20 30 mins of another game but with this you only need 5 10 fun game but if your on edge wait until theres a decent sale going on or until you have a stable group of friends to play with
title: Rocket League®

review: Whether it s online casual or ranked matches no pressure exhibitions split screen local co op with up to four players or an intense 36 week season mode Rocket League is all about getting into the next throttle pounding match as fast as possible. Unfortunately servers are still struggling which means your mileage may vary day to day when it comes to online features. But the silver lining is the mostly formidable AI can make even offline matches interesting and tense. The execution of this simple idea is so strong and so engaging that it keeps bringing me back time and time again for just one more match. (Read the archived original Rocket League review.)Now nearly three years later and with all the additional updates features and new platforms (including the newly launched Nintendo Switch version) Psyonix s insane formula of rocket powered cars playing sports has only gotten better with age.The great news is that the key ingredient in Rocket League hasn t changed a bit. The rules are simple two teams of cars drive really fast around over a dozen glossy brightly colored arenas doing fancy tricks and smashing an endlessly ricocheting oversized ball into the goal. The satisfying heart of Rocket League very much lives in that arcadey feeling of fluid and unrestricted movement.

review: I had fun playing this game so don't take my negative review as me saying that the game sucks. The reason I give this a negative review is due to the fact that it is described as being "Cross Platform" so I thought that meant that I could play with my brother on his PS4 in an organized game. Unfortunately that was not the case. The only way to play "Cross Platform" is for the game to randomly match you up with someone on the PS4 which sucks because the only reason I bought it was to play it online with my brother and friends from their PS4s. So if you're buying this game to play with people online while they are on the PS4 don't it's not what you expect. Luckily Steam has a very nice refund policy so at least I didn't waste my money.

review: I don't do reviews for many games... But I just had to for this one... I'll go to greater depths but the TL DR is that this is a fu***ng masterpiece.Scores Sound 10/10Gameplay 10/10Online experience 8/10Overall 9.5/10Sound Not much to say... The whole soundtrack and in game sound effects are amazing wouldn't change a thing.Gameplay Easy to play very very hard to master... Anyone can pick this up and in five minutes learn how to play it by themselves even though the tutorials are very good and helpful. But the best part is that the more you play the more you perfect your technique and gameplay... let's just say I'm closing in on the 100 hours and I still have much to learn. Amazing job by the developers.Online experience Okay this is where I have something important to say the only reason why this game isn't a perfect 10 in my opinion is that there are some things that need to get fixed of tweaked... First of all servers some servers are great others are just laggy and some can't even start a match properly... Once I was even kicked out because I lost connection while my 10+Mb glass fiber internet connection was working fine and got banned for 15 minutes because reasons... Should not happen on official servers... And my second big complain is the lack of a mute button... We all know it is essential for any online game and if there is one here it must be taunting me because I can't see my cursor while playing even when I press Tab... The rest are just minor tweaks and things that I personally would like to see changed but that's just my opinion which is not always right.Overall Rocket League is an amazing fun game that should be enjoyed by everyone. While there are some things that need to be fixed or tweaked those don't even come anywhere close to damaging the experience you'll have on this amazing one of a kind game... Weather you are looking for fun with your friends hardcore blood rushing action or simply entertainment this is the game you're looking for... It's one of those that bring some hope to the gaming industry when dark times arrive... A masterpiece.

review: Rocket League was fun but not anymore. It takes me 10 30 min to find a match online. I can't play on other server otherwise i get 200+ ping. The South African servers takes so long just to get a match for me to play. The 4v4 is bad. What i mean is in the South African the 4v4 are these weird club members that have these the same name but diffrent number behind. I have reported them but they are still there. they are afk they have 320 ping and the lobby is full. There is one bot but thats it. Plz go and fix it. It's a problem because we(South Africans) can't play on it. my country does not want to report this problem because it's too much effort to even try to fix it. So here i am alone trying to fix it. Thats my only complaint. The sound and music of this game is beautiful and graphics are superb. The bots are nice to fight and the offline is a blast with intense matches. I would reccommend this game to other players from other countrys to get this game if it is your style. The game for it's price is not bad. I see many complain about the skins and content that must be paid but it does not bother me. The skins are a minor complaint. I say if you fix the servers and get these guys out my 4v4 servers on the South African server then we and I would appreciate it. I know that South Africa is not a massive gaming community and that we may not be 1 world class like europe but some of us do love videogames and would give it a try. If the game is good and the communty can stop being toxic to each other then there can be a solid experiance. Sorry for the long text. This is from me and what i have experianced. I will allow any comment that you may have.

review: This is one of my favorite games of all time! I've been playing for about 2.5 years and am a pretty experienced player. Rocket League demonstrates how a dirt simple game that is immediately understandable can have a sky high skill ceiling. Each game you play is different and is packed with hard decisions that must be made quickly and mechanics that must be mastered in order to move the ball the way you want. There is very little RNG and most goals can be prevented with better play. Fair warning the game is difficult and it will take a long time to be able to competently execute most of the core mechanics. Much of the lower ranks consist of players flailing wildly around the ball.The game looks and runs well I've not had any major gripes with performance or settings.The game has a ton of content in the form of cars and cosmetics and the gameplay is deep enough that I don't really want more than a few modes to play. There's tons of training options to improve your mechanics.Matchmaking and ranking can be frustrating but I don't really know how they could improve it. At higher ranks especially playing alone against parties can feel like a big disadvantage. Smurfing and boosting does occur as well. The issue is that play becomes faster and faster and smaller mistakes are punished more and more often. So if you're playing alone and two people go for the same ball it will often lead to a goal against. Again I don't really have a recommendation on how to fix this but it is an observation that if you want to reliably win games in the mid to high champ ranks in team playlists you will need to either be incredibly good mechanically or have a team. I regularly bounce between low Champ 1 and low Champ 3 in Standard (which I play without a party) despite changing very little about my own play.The first few months that I played this game though I was a casual player who played mostly with friends. Still I loved it. The physics and gameplay just feel so good so satisfying and so rewarding to improve at. Getting that close save scoring the big goal or even passing to teammates is always a great feeling. You should buy this cheap and deeply fun game.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is the big brother of two videogames the first being SARPBC. In this game you play a match of car soccer ("Soccar") or any of the other smaller game modes by controlling your own personalised Battle Car. The gameplay is simple to learn but hard to master. Once you feel like you are up for a challenge you can move out of casual lobbies into competitive lobbies in which your wins and losses are tracked as you try to make it to the top.

review: To me this is the ultimate Video Game.This game is beautifully crafted and combines two things I love completely Soccer and Video Games. The level of detail put into this game is astounding. You can find something new on every map every time you play the game even if you're like me and have put over 700 hours into it.This game is the epitome of skill hard work and determination. Every decision you make is up to YOU and YOUR decisions can make or break a match.The community is extremely active and it's also one of the nicest fanbases I've ever been a part of. Sure there may be a few toxic player but that's just the loud minority.This is also the Ultimate eSport as the skill ceiling keeps raising higher and higher. The only limit to what shots and plays you can pull up is your imagination. The professional players astound everyone with their level of on and off ball efficieny positioning and decision making. Anyone can go on to twitch.tv/rlesports and watch the pros and get better because of it.All in all this is my favorite game ever and I think it will stay that way for a long time. This game can be a starting point for someone wanting to get into video games or can be a challenge for elite players. I've missed a lot of other great things about this game in this review but I think this is really all that needs to be said about what a masterpiece Psyonix has produced.

Oh you actually won 2vs3 no promotion for you. So until this game actually improves the ranking system its fustrating as hell and it infuriates me to get stuck on a bad rank when searching solo because a teammate leaves or is toxic and throws the game.Solution Increase the penalty for abandoning and for toxic behaviour and don't penalise the team if 1 player leaves in ranked.

review: This game used to be a 10/10 for me now days I can't give it an honest rating above 7/10. And here is why...1. A very toxic player base that is nice and friendly while they are ahead in matches then flip out at ANY mistakes made when losing.2. Broken match making that pairs you with literal anchors that can't even rack up 100 points in 5 minutes leading to heavily one sided games. Don't believe me? Try solo competitive 3v3.3. Servers are slowly getting worse. No matter what your settings/hardware are you WILL get stutters that are random and tend to happen in the least opportunistic of situitions.4. RL's current business model. YOU NOW HAVE TO PAY WITH KEYS TO BUY THE SEASON PASS TO EARN REWARDS IN RANKED PLAY... WTF! I can honestly see this game going free to play within a year.Comparing this game to what it use to be I have to sadly say to recommending this game!Update October 2018 You can no longer redeem special event points for keys to unlock crates (you have to buy keys with real money we use to be able to buy up to five keys with special event points). SMH

review: Psyonix drowns this wonderful game in loot boxes ugly novelty cosmetics and pushy e sports nonsense. Every update means more disk space used for trinkets. Customization lacks even rudimentary features because why select a color for something when each color of each item can be a special individual drop (that you'll probably never see)?Still the greatness of the game shines through. It's a true gem of the action side of video gaming.Fantastic game play and skill depth. I can't agree with the devs' choice to make car hitboxes completely rectangular and not at all follow the shapes of the cars and I feel flying has a larger than ideal role but aside from that and some occasional wonky edge/corner physics the system is solid and let's you play and enjoy the game at many levels.The soccer basketball and volleyball modes add a ton to the game. The hockey mode is cute for variety. The soccer+powerups mode is quite poorly designed but serviceable for some wacky fun.You get four way local split screen with or against bots (AI could be a lot better but you at least have several levels) and you also have full local online with group online play. Every game should be so complete. It's a perfect couch game as far as that. It does not however lend itself well to widely disparate skill levels playing together.There's also a rudimentary training mode with workshop support. That has some potential but we'll have to see if anything really good comes of it.

review: Ahhhh what a shame.1200 hours in and the developer Psyonix has abandoned any veneer that they're not purely interested in cash and have repeatedly ignored feature requests from the community only to spend all of their time creating new lootboxes to encourage the kids to gamble and now a seasonal pass.I was still having fun in the game after turning crates off (a laudable feature) but now that the fun casual modes Rumble Hoops and Snowday are competitive ONLY in the latest update they've replaced the fun with pain.I'll be back if they change it back and make it fun again but for now the game has lost all apeal to me. I'm nearly 900 hours in. I don't think I need to point out that I like the game but perhaps I can explain why it's fun to an outsider thinking about trying it with a few simple bullet points Not time demanding games are 5 minutes long with goal replays and kickoffs that usually takes it to 7. Overtime happens if your tied and then you can take it to 10. No punishment no grind if you dont like a game you're playing leave. It might hurt your team so think if you want to help them out or hinder them before doing so but there is no impact to leaving. Fast matchmaking as an Aussie I'm accustomed to match finding sometimes taking 10 minutes or more. Was very pleasantly surprised to see how many people still played this game even 2 years after launch. A game can usually be found within 1 minute often within seconds. Casual and competitive somehow this game is both Fun you drive and fly a rocket car in a soccer match. With explosions. And hats

review: Product received for free. After 100 in this game..&gt I learned that my mother had relationship with 14 other people&gt My hair turned white (no joke)&gt I lost my will to live&gt I saw more mental illness than a doctor in a mental hospital&gt I had 2 micro strokes (pure miracle I am alive)&gt I learned that there isn't something more dangerous that 7 year olds in a clan&gt I started developing mental illness&gt I developed self hatred&gt I had to buy 2 more keyboards&gt I started questioning what I am doing with my life&gt I had nightmares because of this game&gt I learned that complaining for your trash team is the solution when you are losing &gt I realised that this is a game about flying like a plane but with a car&gt I learned how to predict the future 5 seconds ahead (because of that ballchasing thing)&gt I woke up my neighbours at 4 am (I mean how the **** do you get choked when the score is 6 0 for you)&gt I got verbally harassed and I had to get myself a therapist&gt He didn't help me at all&gt Spoiler alert! He was Dr Phil I beat him in 1v1 and I instantly felt better (true story) 1/10 This game hurt my soul and I want a refund

There seems to be two sides to this game trading and playing. I like to mix them together trade n play but with both sides means if you start finding say trading boring you can just play and try to rank up same way the other way around. Amazing game Great purchase Worth your money Have a good day Hope this was helpful. Mr Racc

review: The Ultimate Rocket League Experience&gt be me a Canadian that just started replaying Rocket League that all he's ever known was politeness and kindness.&gt my friends get off&gt I queue online ranked&gt I score 5 goals the score is 5 0&gt I was at the other side of the field because I whiffed a shot teammate is in goal.&gt teammate misses&gt he proceeds to write in all caps "YOU ARE FUC**** TRASH AT THIS GAME NOBODY WILL EVER LOVE YOU AND YOU WILL DIE ALONE WHY ARE YOU PLAYING RANKED? WHY ARE YOU AT THE OTHER SIDE OF THE FUC**** MAP?&gt I tell him to chill&gt That wasn't a great idea.&gt with 2 30 seconds left in the game he whiffs his kickoffs by purpose and own goals until they win the game&gt This reminds me of the modern warfare xbox 360 days when I was a console peasant&gt He adds me calls me a loser and more&gt I go to his wishlist&gt I see that he wants Fallout 76&gt I buy him Fallout 76 telling him "Merry Christmas have a happy 2019."&gt He is so grateful and tells me i'm his only friend that would ever do something nice for him&gt He's been playing for two weeks almost non stop from 3 AM until nightLittle did he know this was my plan to make him waste his life on a wasteful unpolished and unoptimized game saving the Rocket League community by this guy destroying all of his teammates in his path.Seriously Rocket League is great fun and worth the experiences like these.
title: Rocket League®

review: Product received for free. READ THIS BEFORE STARTING THIS GAMEthe absolute first thing you need to do is MAP YOUR AIR ROLL BUTTONS this is especially important since they aren't bound to the controller under default settings to begin with. even if you tell yourself you don't need to worry about it yet as you're "just trying out" the game lol i 100% guarantee you will keep playing... and then you'll be kicking yourself for not listeningwhen boosting through the air ("aerialing") your car basically works like an airplane. your pitch and raw (google image basic plane movements) are simple enough and will come natural... but in order to ROLL you must go into settings and MAP THEM individually to your controller. the three things you need to map are AR (air roll) AR RIGHT and AR LEFT. do a little bit of reading on the message boards to see what layouts other people have been successful with. you "technically" do not need to map all three of themthe game is SIGNIFICANTLY more involved than it looks and is SIGNIFICANTLY more difficult to master at a competitive level.however far you choose to progress (takes PRACTICE PATIENCE and EXPERIENCE) the good news is you'll be having fun all along the way )
title: Rocket League®

review: 10/10.For a long time games have been one and the same nothing new nothing fun or challenging this game is different. When i saw it it reminded me of my childhood and a lot of fun games in it that were a lot like this. The game it self is a great example of new mixed with old and football and cars. When you start this game it's very hard for you to learn how the game works how the cars work and so on. My advice is start looking for tutorials and make sure that you follow them.The DLC of the game are not exactly cosmetic but they have some advantages and some of them are worth it. I'm recommending it to everybody who wants to have fun. If you have played back in the day games like Re Volt and Twisted Metal you should buy it.The Game is fun and definitely worth the buy.

review: Probably the weirdest game I've played in a long time. You're literally a car chasing a ball. I love it! The reason why this game is such a gem in my steam library is partly because of the grind and addiction or in my case blood sweat &amp tears. It's one of those games you just put your heart into just to learn that specifik trick. Not only that there's a whole other community in this game other than the actual players. The trading community is huge in this game! There are not many games I can think of that has this big of a community market. It even makes this game better. title: Rocket League®

review: I used to love this game but now i feel like its taking the path that CSGO took and let me explain why.1. Ranked The ranked system is completely ed. any rank player can play with anyone. at its extreme an unranked player can que with a Grand Champion (highest tier rank) with no problems. Every other game has some sort of rank restrictions. whether its only in the same tier (bronze silver gold etc.) within the same 3 divisions (silver 3/Gold 3) or some others but not rocket league! This gives way to MASSIVE BOOSTING problems. now im not saying you come across god tier players often. It's more of the opposite. I cannot tell you how many trash players there are in the upper ranks with no idea how to play. It seems like they care more about releasing more crates than a fix to their ranked system. More on that later.2. Development The old school rocket league would come out with MAJOR UPDATES new maps new modes whole new everything. Now its just oh lets add another crate with some t items that people will only want the black markets out of but no one will ever get them.3. The Crate system When the crate system first launched players were ACTIVELY getting black markets colored exotics etc but now the odds of getting those are so low its comparable to a CSGO knife. Which leads me to the point of them focussing on crates. It seems like since RL got to be an official ESPORT they focus soley on sales of keys which is why it seems like they lowered the drop rates and push out a ton of new crates left and right but dont really do anything else.Conclusion Rocket League is an incredibly fun game to play especially with friends. However their ranked system is ed they dont develop content like they used to and it seems like they focus solely on cashgrabbing with keys. I would hate to see a beloved game like Rocket League sell out to cash grabbing but it appears thats what we are getting nowadays. If you dont care about a broken ranked system or dont care about development then this is your game. If you care about ranked systems and development steer clear. I will still play this game as it is my favorite game despite my review. However i will not play NEARLY as much as i used to. At the time of writing this i played 3.5 hours in 2 weeks which is down from my usual 2 hours or so a day i used to play. The ranked system just makes the game unenjoyable and pointless to even play.
title: Rocket League®

review: I love this game and I have invested Mega Hours into it. However huge downside is all the creates and trading bulshit. I bearly tolerated all the DLC's now if you want a new car you need to unlock a ing crate.... kinda gay.(edit) The main reason Im changing this from recommended to Not recommended is if your a new coming into the game... Prepare for disapointment (... unless you buy all the DLC's invest in trading and Get good quick... your life is going to be tough to start off. All the stock cars are The DLC cars are pretty good However crate cars are generally the best. If you intend to get good quick.... Draggs three top noob things to learn is 1 Hitting the ball consisantly (not ariels... just on the ground dribbling and hitting)2 Rotation (where you should be on the feild at the given moment)3 Goal Tending (Yip dont be afraid of the goalie spot as in rotation you need to know when you should be in here)Why not.... Basic rotation defence one in goal two out... If goalie leaves be prepared to become goalie....(important Goalie does not leave untill ball is past half way going away from you.)Attack Two forward One mid feild or further back.... Its really hard but the two on attack should not both be in a corner trying to cross the ball... as there will be noone to cross too.... If one of the attackers s up the attack pull out to top up on Nos and Mid feilder goes in.There is no baby mode so expect to come up against seasoned veterans pretty fast. this is why I dont recommend this game its alot to learn and your never going to look as fancy as everyone else.Anyway no game is ever the same and its an action packed 5 mins per round

review: Every moment in Rocket League demands split second judgment. Are you the assertive type who takes control of the immediate situation at the risk of being in the middle of a chaotic unpredictable scrum? Are you more of a long term planner one who watches your cohorts fight over a ball in a corner with the confidence that the ball will inevitably escape. When this happens are you ready at the top of the penalty arc with the hope that the loose ball will roll between you and the goal?
title: Rocket League®

review: When the game first came out it was amazing The game is good. If you have freinds stick with them if you dont i wouldnt bother. sighEveryone thinks they're amazing. no one accepts tips on how to improve and its..Slowly becoming one of the worst toxic comunities. Even when your winning games your teammates are likely to tell you "you're s**t" "get good" this while other sare telling you to "die of cancer" and calling you every name under the sun. Yes you can report but like iv seen it does nothing psyonix say they "view all reports and we take them seriously" No they don't they have the same report system as blizzard where the person needs a number of reports first before its even looked at (and that could be needing a hundred reports)

review: Incredible performance can work in either old computers or new ones and it doesn't affect gameplay in the slightless. The game has some tutorials to learn how to play and plenty of workshop tutorials for specific and more challenging mechanics. Talking about mechanics the game has a really high ceilling for the people that not only want to play ball with cars but to do so with style.There's not a single P2W mechanic in the game the only microtransactions being cosmetics.In customizations there's plenty of cars to choose and customize options are all over the place.The game IS better and funnier with friends in my opinion.totally recommend this game!

review: I actually LOVE RL. but the current state of Psyonix not giving a crap about ranked has to change. Why are players allowed to que for ranked with a guest on their machine as a partner you realize any silver pos can invite his diamond friend over and carry him. You realise how unfun that makes it for the players in that actual elo? And if it werent bad enough that that goes noticed but uncared about you can que ranked with any diffence of rank and mmr. Im a plat 3 and i frequently get smashed in duos to high diamond low master players boosting their little silver friend who sits in the goal while big bro carries him. Maybe im hoping psyonix will read this and figure some out you are making competitive ingenuine with the LACK of guidelines and allow boosting to run rampant. And nowhere on steam or their site can you give nonbug related feedback so here it is.
title: Rocket League®

review: After 51 hours of gameplay it's been quite a 'ride'. This game made the wacky idea of "Soccer with cars" into a reality that makes it fun and addictive. At the start it may seem difficult but with time you can progressively develop skill like how practice works for pretty much anything. It's entirely multiplayer with things to unlock and of course play with friends. It eventually feels repetitive though and have a merely toxic community but at the end I don't have any complaints whatsoever and I see this as a masterpiece. Not the greatest but fun. 8/10 recommend you to play. Console is recommended but I do keyboard.
title: Rocket League®

review: This is unquestionably one of the best multiplayer experiences out there especially with its far too rare support of cross platform play. However the facts that the cross platform grouping keeps getting delayed and Fortnite style season passes were added to a pay to play game tarnish its previously stellar reputation a bit in my mind. I used to open crates as a show of support because I thought the game was worth more than I paid for it but I just can't do it anymore. I'm down to only playing during holiday events and I don't even collect all the items exclusive to those anymore because of how ridiculous the cares have become.

review: Do you love sports? Do you love video games? If yes this game is for you. It takes real practice time and skill. Extremely quick field transitions and constant action 24/7 with over 100 000 people online at almost all hours. They are always updating changing but every car has the same stats in ever way ragardless of style. The bigges cars can have an advantage with a bigger hitbox but thats about it. This game is the best example of what an Esport truly is i have never been so hype playing a game in my life. Its worth $20 and it is a steal when half priced. I am nowhere near even good and im Platinum.

review: In my experience with this game I would recommend just to try it.GAMEPLAY Gameplay is very original. It has many mechanics you can play with and try something new and many mechanics that had not been discovered yet. The playstyles in this game are infinite. You can combine the mechanics to make some crazy plays.It is fun for many people at once. You can play in 1v1 2v2 3v3 4v4. Some modes are also ranked.There are also additional gamemodes to look at and make for some amazing time. The problem is the bots who are almost useless and ruin gameplay.COMMUNITY I would say that this community is pretty toxic. From my point of view atleast. Almost every game someone disconnects from your game and it makes it unfair. Ofcourse the player gets replaced by a bot but the bots have bad AI. But not all people are so bad. I have met many friends in this game and play with them until today.DESIGN Lets start with the turorial...The tutorial makes you learn just basic things like jumping and how to drive. It is not that in depth tutorial and you will have to look up most mechanics online to understand them.Then there are training packs made by players or the devs. Here you can try some training packs which increase your skill in your games. You have a very big selection of them and can even create your own one for FREE.Then you have the car selection and customization...You have a very big selection of cars to choose from so find the one that suites your playstyle the best. You have the basic cars which require no currency to unlock. These you have unlock by playing the game and getting them as rewards form matches. There are only few but will do the job. Then you also have the paid cars. DLC cars and microtransaction cars from Crates. They are not that expensive but almost noone uses them.You can customize every car except the Batmobile. From the decals to antenas and motor sounds.In conclusion this game is good to try but gets old just after 100 hours. The ranking system is weird with many bugs like dropping 3 divisions after a lost gmae for which you had to play 10 games. It also has many RNG like 50/50s and pinches.I would recommend this game.
title: Rocket League®

review: So I deleted my review so I could redo this and maybe point out to people the they do is a bannable offense.https //www.rocketleague.com/news/code of conduct and banning policy/ If you scroll down on the CoC smurfing is a bannable offense. I have run into more smurfs lately on here than I have actual players and it's stupid. Psyonix needs to enforce their ban policies I've reported over the past year probably close to 50 to 100 smurfs that have been on (IE Level 1 and Level 2 steam accounts with little to no hours on RL have their profile hidden or partly hidden and are pulling air tricks off in Bronze to low Silver.)I don't care who you ing are play at your own ing level rather than coming down to the lower ranks where people are actively trying to get up and ruin the game completely for them. If I could get a refund right now I'd sure as hell get one since Psyonix doesn't seem to care for this issue even if reports are filed using the ingame report system.Edit To add another update RL servers are still extremely unstable ping wise for me as of late I'll most likely be uninstalling the game as issues from smurfs being on constantly to lag issues with the server on wired and non wired connection I think I've had enough of the issues now.

review: This is about the 5th time I've changed this review and gone from UP to DOWN and back UP again.I'll keep it short this time.This game is tons of fun and totally unique. It's one of those games that you just have to try.The downsides come and go and there is still lots of room for improvement. The company doesn't seem keen on moving real fast with game fixes and enhancements but they do happen eventually. Their strongest suit is just adding content to the game.Bottom line is there are downsides but it's well worth trying. Just look at how many hours I have in and you'll know that no matter how much there is that I dislike there's more of it to like.

review: Wish I had gotten this game sooner. For those considering getting it. It's a very simple game. You play ball with cars and try to score goals while keeping your opponents from doing the same. The controls are very responsivel both on keyboard and mouse. And the game is just plain fun. I don't even typically like sports outside of watching it with a boyfriend usually and furthermore I don't much like to race cars either haha. So for me the fact that I ended up having so much fun here was quite interesting!The game features several games modes but I have only played 3 of them. The simplest ones in fact. 1v1 2v2 and 3v3. You can party up with friends from steam. The game features cross platform gameplay but I do not believe you can team up with friends on PSN I am unsure I don't have friends who play it on PSN. I never have to wait more than 30 40 seconds to enter a match no matter what mode I have tried. You can compete in competative gameplay in 2v2 and 3v3..and maybe even 1v1 but I'm not certain as I've never tried 1v1 competatively.The games soundtrack is among one of the best I have heard in a long time absolutely great soundtrack and sound quality. The DLC cars are pretty cheap cosmetics. But the game gives you a metric ton of cosmetics for free as you progress just for playing the game. As well as loot boxes which you could purchase keys for at I believe 1$ per key. Loot boxes offer random loot ranging from really useless to really awesome. Typical as far as that goes.You can trade loot boxes with people you meet in steam for keys and such so you essentially will never have to pay a dime if you don't want to. The community is fairly hit and miss as with any competative game just don't let the salty people get to you and you will be fine. The game does seem easy enough that anybody can get in and have fun but despite this it can get pretty hard to beat good players and it rewards learning how to do some pretty cool tricks using the rockets and angles of your car to hit the ball just right. All in all I really have no complaints about this game. Perhaps the only complaint is that it doesn't seem to punish the rage quitters but I am unsure since I am not one if that is true or not. You will see plenty of them in competative. Sometimes after the first few moments after the first score isn't your teams score. It usually snowballs from there into a total forfiet match. But when that does not happen the games go smooth and run fine and are really fun.Lastly getting back to the cosmetics..its really fun just messing around with your cars looks after unlocking new cool stuff to use. A fairly decent amount of customization is in the game based on what cosmetics you get ranging from paint jobs wheels antenna's rocket boost exhausts goal explosions toppers (cute little ornaments you can put on the top of your car like a witch or wizard hat for instance just to be silly) The sound of the engine..etc. For it's simplicity and plug and play ability I give the game a 10/10. I went into it expecting to hate it. But it exceeded my expectations by a huge margin and I really don't have any complaints about the game itself.
title: Rocket League®

review: To me Rocket League is one of the few modern competitive games I feel is actually worth investing time into due to its focus on pure balanced gameplay. Keeping everything on an even playing field with no classes gear or ability systems throwing off the balance. If you win you earned it.Even with the relatively straight forward mechanics of the game there is still an insane skill ceiling built around an ever growing range of community discovered moves and techniques. It is up to you to decide where to put your time train and learn techniques you find interesting build a play style that works for you. If you ever manage to master every technique and feel like you have nothing left to learn you ll probably find you got your money s worth.

review: *EDIT*So now i'l at 700 hours of playing in this game I bought the season pass.... and now I cannot play the game. Is it for my time that I can spend on game? No because I could easily rise up on the ranked but for some things i can't reach diamond."Why? You suck bro you can't play it's not other one's fault"... that's not the problem...PSYONIX I SPENT 10 FOR BUYING THAT DAMN SEASON PASS MORE THAN 50 IN KEYS OR DLCS AFTER A MONTH I'M ONLY AT LEVEL 4 BECAUSE YOU YES I MEAN YOU A BAD DEVELOPERS TEAM WHO DON'T READ AT YOUR FANS REVIEW OR TIPS DON'T UPDATE AND TRY TO FIX THOSE POTATO SERVERS.Until the last update I could play with my slow connection but at least I could play at 80ms of ping not the best but HEY! i could play and rise up from gold to platinum 3.Here comes the last update I spent over 100 to get a better connection in my house with my money that sould go on my guitar teacher but no I wasted to trying to play to what WAS a nice game then I tried to play but no that's not playing... this is not a game anymore. A game is where you can rage have fun with friends having fun choosing the best car modifications a game where also with a low keys car you could hear from the enemies that it wasn't so bad the beautiful feeling of seeing a white octane and screaming for the happiness... This is NOT a game ANYMOREAnd now this is what Rocket league was really for me a few month before the update i recommended this game now not at all...After 488 hours on this game i tought about to review my experience on this game.I bought this game one month after the releasing of the game on steam.I started with my pink controller but it get broken (chinese plastic if you know what i mean) so i started playing on keyboard + mouse. My first 2 weeks got really bad i couldn't understand the keybindings so i decided to make my own keyboard configuration no mouse support. I totally got into the commands in almost 2 years and 450 hours learning to dribble (a bit) and air ball control.Do I recommend this game?Absolutely yes! You will find a lot of nice people you will make new friends even if you are not a toxic person.I got friends from all over the world playing this game from Brasil to Holland from here in Italy to Turkey from Germany to Japan keeping with em contact and talking about everything like irl friends.Oh yeah and mostly you will have a lot of fun playing this game

review: Rocket League is my #1 favorite game of all time. The game masterfully balances the crazy fast paced action with the slower methodical strategizing which is essential for success.When I first got this game I was s*** but as I played more and more I had a strong feeling of progression. Soon I became a pro veteran and now an expert. After becoming more and more obsessed with this game I started soaring through the sky to hit the ball into the goal.The only thing that is negative is that when you first start playing it's relatively hard to play but the matchmaking is usually good and you'll get better in no time anyways.11/10P.S. The all new trade in system adds an all new motivation to play. Receive uncommon items that you can keep or trade in to get rares. Trade in rares to get very rares. Look forward to Psyonix adding in more rare and very rare items.*Nominated this game for an award*

review: I really love this game. It is easy for newcomers to join in can be easily played as a single player has a large online player base (at least for all of 2016 as of this post) plays in short bursts (5 minute games). I really don't play much online multiplayer for games but this is a lot of fun. The soccer with cars is actually done really well. The controls are great. Give it a chance. Personally I love the 2 on 2 matches but I also play 3 on 3 as well. Ranked matches are best because people stick with them and don't drop in &amp out but unranked can be fun too.At first you can just stay on the ground and can probably do a decent job getting an opportunity here and there to slam into the ball score or make lucky passes. But keep playing and you'll start to get better as you learn to use the jump and boost a bit better. But this is a game where you don't just get killed like a newcomer to some FPSs.More than a year later and I still really enjoy this game. The new rewards systems are nice too like the holiday themed play money to get items as a reward for play time during special events.

review: UPDATE Rumble Mode A hilarious addition to an already amazing game. The power ups are so well balanced but all effective in their own unique ways. Goal stealing and spectacular saves are more fun than ever! Hoops Update An absolutely fantastic addition to the game. Sure it's odd to start with but it's something different! I've heard complaints that the arena is too small but I think that adds to it. It means a lot more goals and a lot more skill needed to defend and score. 100% top addition to Rocket League.This game is the love child of Micro Machines and FIFA. Genuinely one of the best games I've played in a while. Such a vast amount of customisation options local and online multiplayer make this a great experience all round and the short games keep it short and sweet. A well thought through game!The addition of the Supersonic Fury DLC and free update is very much welcomed! Two extra cars with unique decals two new sets of tyres new flags and new arenas are amazing to play with. I can only hope for more arenas to play in with new themes and hopefully more decals for all the current cars!A game I will be playing for a long time to come!

review: 10/10Dynamika gry muzyka piękna grafika proste zasady szybkie samochody i piłka nożna. To jest to co faceci lubią. Rozgrywki są szybkie dynamiczne i uzależniają. Na początek podchodziłem do tego tytułu sceptycznie jednak wraz z jej odpaleniem wszystko to przestało mieć znaczenie. Pierwsza rzecz jaka pierwsza wpada w ucho po odpaleniu to świetny soundtrack nadający specyficzny klimat. Po odpaleniu pierwszej gry mamy styczność z powalającą grafiką (każde źdźbło murawy można policzyć) prostotą w sterowaniu i niesamowitymi emocjami jakie niesie kopanie piłki samochodami wykonując niesamowite akrobacje w powietrzu i dokonując demolki na samochodach przeciwników. Akrobacje to bardzo mocna strona tej gry. Sterowanie jest proste a same akrobacje nie są rzeczą jaką uświadczymy tylko u zaawansowanych graczy gdyż nawet początkujący potrafią zachwycić strzelonymi bramkami z wykonaniem niesamowitych manewrów.Gra oferuje także modyfikacje wizualne pojazdów dodając kolorów i tak już pięknej i kolorowej rozgrywce nie oferując żadnych wspomagaczy dla graczy co wszystko sprowadza się do umiejętności indywidualnych i zgrania drużyny.Tryby dla graczy oferują rozgrywkę od 1 na 1 aż po rozgrywki drużynowe 4 na 4. W dodatku posiadają prosty i przejrzysty samouczek oraz trening w akrobacjach strzelaniu do bramki i rozgrywek z botami.Całkiem niespodziewanym gadżetem tej gry jest możliwość grania na podzielonym ekranie na wszystkich platformach PS4 XBOX i PC co zadowoli graczy chcących zmierzyć się ze znajomymi czy rodzeństwem na jednej platformie.Tej gry nie da się nie lubić. Jeden z niespodziewanych i najlepszych tytułów 2015 roku!!

review: An amazingly simple simple concept for a game that does everything right for itself. It is simple to play and yet challenging to 'master' requires no prior knowledge of sports or cars to play and rewards teamplay and singular effort alike. IMO its true value is that the game is centered soley on skill and that the ranking/matchmaking system ensures you play with people as 'skilled' or as 'casual' as you are. Recieving items leveling up and gaining new titles is entirely cosmetic. Each game is dynamically different as you'd expect with any sport match irl and makes for a new experience every match. Highly recommended!

review: There's not that much to say about this game.It's a dead simple concept. Rocket powered cars hit a ball hopefully into the goal of your opponents. That's it.You are going to hatelove this game with a passion.Simple concept but so challenging to be actually good at.You'll never be as good as you think you are. Even the best players make mistakes.But you'll come back for more. Every match is different from the one before. And you'll get better.Solid advice Turn off ingame voice chat right from the start. Just trust me on this one.Solid advice #2 If you are prone to rage and anger stay away from the Solo Standard competitive queue and play the other lists with people you know. Playing that list can help you reflect your own personality and be a better human but only if you are able to survive in a toxic cesspool of nuclear waste that is the rage of your teammates. As I said you'll make mistakes others will make mistakes. Every time you do they will tell you in unspeakable ways of anger no matter how bad they are themselves. I've played years of League of Legends before. This list is worse. Be prepared.

review: Between xbox ps4 switch and pc I have over 200+ hours in this game. For the money probably one of the best bargains i've gotten ever. That being said I would only reccommend purchase if you have friends or know a community who play. The ranked system is IMO extremely flawed. Games are 1v1 2v2 3v3 and solo3v3(no parties). Once you catch on to gameplay and get gold/ platinum rank the game has a system of weeding players out of legibility for higher ranking groups by sticking them with players who match your rank but are drastically different experience and skill levels. In layman's terms when you "git gud" you're going to be matched with "trash" players. I've played almost 10 games today highest scorer in each lobby and I don't think I won one game. OH AND RANKED IS BASED SOLELY ON WINS. So if you score 1000 points and lose you still go down in rank.. Love the game although the ranking system is not pragmatic in fixing its issues. Some may call this review and attitude toxic I believe the ranking system enables toxicity by its poor matchmaking system. 7/10 as of now 9/10 if they make a change to matchmaking system.

review: This is my first review. Why? Because this game is that much fun! You should know! I play online multi player games exclusively like Overwatch Smite LoL Faeria Hearthstone Battlerite. But Rocket League is the easiest pick of all my games when I don't know which one to choose. I think I've had the most fun with Rocket League aswell. Sure when you get to Gold from silver standards there's Aerials all over the place and it's way more competitive. It can become frustrating if you play too much. But you'll always come back to it with a smile. Make sure you read atleast some other reviews here. This game is on a league of its own. It also helps there's way over 150 thousand people online huge tournaments ect. Unlike faeria which is the best card game but has like 250 people... 150 thousand means you'll always find people of your skill level. Easily!This game is like a sport on steroids. With all kinds of different tricks you can pull off with boost more boost! I'll only score the gameplay. 9.9/10 compared to todays standard. Have fun playing rocket league! Because you will!

review: I have played this game for 1000+ hours across many platforms and I can say that it is incredible. It's one of my favourite games to this day. The community is quite diverse between the toxic players that aim to demo you every 5 seconds and the nice players that help you and don't mouth off if you do something wrong. It's a great game to play with friends and can really help build great teamwork and communication skills between you and your friends. The game itself is very diverse with its game modes and maps supplying interesting scenarios to try. The community practice levels are brilliant and really help with building your gameplay mechanics alongside being able to make your own to pratice the shots you always seem to miss. There is a fair learning curve if you want to get really good but I find most people will develop at their own pace and will get good after playing long enough. If you want to get better you don't have to change your controls and start playing "claw" either just choose what feels good for you I use basically default controls and I get around just fine. There are a fair few customization options for your cars. Some people might hate me for this and I am well aware they have made more colours for the teams that you can choose from. But in my personal opinion I think it would be great to have a wider variety of colours to choose from to customise your car. But that's just my thoughts/opinion. The servers can be buggy and laggy at times but overall I find them to be fine. I can't wait for when you can party up with other platforms. Great game 10/10 would be called a "fat nerd" again for dunking on a solo during my placement matches.
title: Rocket League®

review: "Car Soccar" may sound like an unbelievable concept. Once you play it though you see how this simple idea of driving combined with a giant ball is turned in to an addictive and wonderful game. The car and ball physics takes a while to learn and forever to master. No matter your skill level you will see people better than you making awesome skill shots and blowing easy plays.It is fast paced. Matches take about 5 minutes to play. You will often find yourself going to play a game and sticking around for a few more. Once you get a good team and a set of opponents it is easy to ask for a rematch.This is one of those games I keep going back to. There is always something to learn or get better at.The dev team has done a great job keeping the game updated as well as adding new content. The collectables in the game are a great incetive to keep playing. It adds something that can be earned and is not pay to win or microtransaction based. Yes there are added stuff that you can pay for like Keys to open Crates. Most items can be earned just by playing and ranking up.
title: Rocket League®

review: Addictive and super fun game which turns out to be extremely competitive and challenging once you pass a certain level. You'll be so happy when you score your first goal. When you hit your first aerial. When you learn how to half flip and dribble and control the ball in the air. Oh god when you hit your first backboard double touch. Or ceiling shot. Then 500 hours in a typical Friday night you smash your desk because you just got demoted from Champ 3 by some ballchasing goober who wanted to forfeit after going 0 1 with over 3 minutes remaining. Next game you have a Squishy wannabe who doesn't understand the concept of a play that doesn't revolve around a ceiling shot (in which he sports an impressive 0% goals. Keep trying though bud any day now). You disable all chat and put your teammates on quick chat only because you can't handle the toxicity. The simple things that gave you joy in the past means nothing now. You suck at this game. You've peaked you hit your skill ceiling. You're washed up. You're never getting GC you'll always be stuck in Champ. Forever. This game is the best of times. This game is the worst of times.

review: Probably the most fun football/soccer game since Nintendo World Cup for the NES at least as far as I am concerned. I have never been the kind of person who likes to compete or cares about winning but for some reason this game makes me want to win a whole lot. It's one of my favorite games ever.Each player gets to drive one car and do whatever it takes to score goals be it drive on walls jump fly or what have you. You can customize your car's appearance with paint jobs "hats" antennas wheels and more and as you play you get more customization items to use for this purpose. You can trade these items with other players who are in your party though it is not obvious how to do it (you have to select the player at the bottom of your screen when you are both in the same party and on a menu screen or something).Unranked play has 1v1 2v2 3v3 and 4v4 modes. Unranked matches can have bots fill in for missing players.Ranked play has 1v1 2v2 3v3 and a 3v3 solo queue mode. There are no bots in ranked play.There are also some special modes where the stages and gameplay are somewhat different.I would recommend a controller for this game as there are some things that are more tricky to pull off at the same time in the keyboard+mouse configuration. The region selector is your friend as it's not very fun to play in distant regions where you get 200 ish ping. I usually just pick my own region plus one region west of me and one region east of me which keeps pings in the 30 100 range most of the time.
title: Rocket League®

review: So I originally bought this game a while ago near when it first came out... I was excited for the gameplay however I really didn't enjoy the way it felt after a few games. I returned it with the let down of having a fun game to play with friends. Innevitably the game went on sale again and there I was a click away from making the same mistake. However this time the Steam Gods were in my favor and the second time around I actually took the time to learn how to play! Oh my gosh go figure learn how to play a game properly and it can be entertaining and fun! Seriously try it. Try thinking about the buttons you're pressing on your controller for a change. That one's for all the veteran keyboard playing button mashers out there. Do it give Rocket League another chance at love and smash some kids dreams and balls in their face with an epic match of back to back goals and immaginary air high fives with strangers you PUG with. Get your game face on and get into the game ... and face it? ... Do it. Do it now.

review: I suppose the time has come for me to finally write the verdict of this game.Even after such a long time has passed since release this game has been an amazing experience from start to end. Every singular movement and decision you take can make or break the game and having that notion engraved into your head makes the competitive drive only rise higher.Progressing further into becoming a better player can go from learning how to drive your car into the ball all the way to doing some weird flip business that'll drop everyone's jaws. It all becomes so natural at some point that you just accept the fact that gravity is constantly being defied in every way possible. What's better is that every month a new technique is discovered for your leisure. Now you can enjoy flying about in the most impossible of ways.With constant additions to the game (and regular updates) I've had a hard time becoming bored of it. Sure a break is necessary every once in a while. After all grinding those ranked games can turn out to be quite exhausting. However you're bound to come back for more. Psyonix and it's community have made a wonderful piece that'll hopefully stand the test of time.
title: Rocket League®

review: Really exotic propposal from the developers on this game. Fortunately they have executed it very well. It lacks a better implementation of cross platform games and more integration with steam community market. The controls are a bit skecthy if you are using a keyboard and mouse players using a controller have a good advantage over you. The lobby system leaves a lot of room for improvements you can't add a player to your friends list at the lobby you have to look for him on the Steam Community. The party sistem is a bit weird mainly at the invitation part. Overall really good game very fun and different from what we are used to see on Steam.

review: Imagine playing a nice match just making an awesome goal.Then randomly lose connection. Internet connection is fine.Try to join back one minute loading screen.Back to main menu you are now banned for "abandoning" a match. Rank severly hurt.Also did you by any chance want to check something on another window while playing the game? Did windows just pop up an alert and focused the desktop? Prepare for the worst and most absurd performance drop when back in the game. Badly ported from PS.Also prepare for menu freeze. Lots of it. Pray you don t get one while joining a match.Also prepare for random rocket league servers lag for days until fixed. Then after a while you get lag period again.Also if you are into keys/crates just don't buy them for this game. 99% chance of a _s i t t y_ decal no one will ever use. They give you the chance to exchange 5 items for one of the next level but all 5 need to be "compatible" (belong to the same series) which is unlikely and you will end up with a stuffed inventory that takes years to load the thumbnails.Good game but unstable matchmaking and performance issues on PC will frustrate you enough.

review: This game is meals on wheels...in terms of gameplay. You have the base mode which is basically a balls to the wall soccer match that you and two other friends/players team up against another fellow team and simply try to score a goal. Easier said than done but there's also hockey basketball dropshot and what Mario Kart ends up being with your closest friends Rumble. The mode names should be pretty self explanatory but imagine them instead with Rocket Cars. Rumble being a favorite of mine and is basically the same as a normal mode but you get power ups and boy howdy can the game get chaotic. Speaking of which there's also Chaos but you're gonna have to buy the game to learn what that is. It is your fate. It is your future pain and you won't regret it...probably. *This game is just as fun for casuals as it is for Rankers. Though I think their souls get sucked out of their body.

review: Great idea make every match a ranked one in the extra games like hockey and rumble mode the games you just want to relax and have some fun RNG with. That way when you get AFK's in your match and you don't want to play with someone who is sitting there you leave but YOU get penalized because its a ranked match. Then when you are in a match and someone chooses to leave whether it be an emergency or not you don't get bots to fill in their place nor can other players join because its ranked since it has to be ranked. Also when you find a really good match with players and you want to face them again because it was fun you can't select "rematch" because its ranked. Great new mechanics. Did I mention the entire game is nothing but ranked matches now? Used to enjoy the game. Thats why I am voting no until they change it back to appease the casual players.

review: IMHO (still) the perfect review for this game is to quote Rekt (https //steamcommunity.com/id/Wrekkt)...Originally posted by Rekt Rocket League has one of the best progression systems I've ever seen in a video game before...Rookie You can't hit You are a disgrace to your team and the game.Semi Pro You can now sometimes hit the ball. Don't even try to hit it in the right direction or think about your positioning. You're only Semi Pro so you can just go ahead and hit that ball! You also made a bicycle hit that one time but yeah nah you're still Pro You have learnt how to shoot the ball accurately from the ground. You're the best! Late into Pro level you would have likely looked up advanced tips for Rocket League. Worst mistake of your life. You now know what aerials are. You think you can fly. The ball comes up high and you go for an aerial. Once you jump you fly straight into the ground and continue to do frontflips until you land on your back... What the happened there? Oh. You're using keyboard. Yeah nah time to get a controller head.Veteran You now have a controller and go for terribly unlikely aerials. You think you're good. You can hit the lower aerials consistently and you can now be considered an addition to your team. Congratulations!Expert You can now consistently hit aerials accurately at any height. This game is now your life. You can also score off a wall every now and then. Good times.Master You are now a god to every level lower than you. You have perfected the art of wall shots. You are an extremely cool person. A nice little bonus is that everyone under the level of Pro will now spam "Sorry!" every time they do something wrong to you.Legend The most badass looking title you can have. Rocketeer. You probably now have an extreme case of false confidence. Once you get used to the badass title you'll wreck anything and anyone with ease. You can also pull off freestyles consistently. Nice job! Also be sure to prepare for an endless stream of "You're not good enough for Legend!"Rocketeer You can now 720 freestyle backflip reverse backwards aerial air dribble off a wall with ease. You probably boosted for that Rocketeer tag. But if you didn't still prepare for another endless stream of "You're not good enough for Rocketeer!"But in all seriousness I absolutely love this game and I'm sure anyone will. I've literally never seen someone dislike this game after they've played 10 hours. (Rocket League moves onto a whole nother level of fun and addiction once you learn how to fly.)If you're still contemplating buying this game after reading this review just trust me when I say it is one of the most fun and addictive games I've ever played (more gripping than Skyrim and GTA).Think about it this way You wouldn't have made it this far through the review if you didn't secretly want this game. Ignore the childish looking pictures on the store page. Just get this game. This is the one.
title: Rocket League®

review: + There's nothing pay to win in the entire game. It's entirely about individual skill and team effort.+ Easy enough to learn the basics.+ Tough but fulfilling to master.+ You can play alone in 1v1 2v2 3v3 or even 4v4 whichever is your preference.+ Fun is more than doubled when playing with friends.+ You're being rewarded regularly for just playing the game.+ You can customize your vehicle quite a bit.+ There are special events with unique rewards quite often.+ There are also alternative game modes for you to choose from if you get tired with normal play modes.+ If you're into esports Rocket League esports scene rapidly growing. If you party up with more than four people you can't really play together unless you play custom matches which can be a bit boring. Queue times can be a bit long although ranked 2v2 and 3v3 queues usually pop pretty fast. Matchmaking can be a bit weird sometimes. It is a popular game with diverse international player base so naturally there are some server stability and connectivity issues. Sometimes the in game chat can be pretty toxic but you can disable text chat and use just the quick chat or no chat at all if that's your preference.

review: I'm pretty sure everyone has heard of Rocket League by now. A simple concept that was even already adapted to certain degree to some gameshows Playing football (soccer) with cars.I'ver been playing Rocket League every now and then during the last few months but only really got into it quite recently. This game is literally for everyone. It does not matter whether you are a pro performing air dribbles and ceiling shots or you are a beginner who can hardly hit the ball. You'll have fun with the game nonetheless (as long as you dont take the online community too serious). The skill cap in this game is insane. If you are looking for a game where you constantly can improve yourself and/or never be finished with learning new stuff then look no further because this is for you. I'm always suprised how such a simple game concept manages to be so technically demanding of players. The reason for this is the exceptionally good physics system that the game utilizes which almost never fails its purpose (except for some minor hickups during connectivity issues)The graphics are also nicely done and completely suited for this game. It probably will not blow your mind which does not mean that it is not pretty to look at because it absolutely is. All in all I can recommend this game to anyone. Especially if there's currently a sale on steam you can get this gem quite cheaply this days. You'll get many hours of fun out of it be it by training your skills or simply fooling around with friens and/or online.

review: Psyonix is one of those companies managing to break stuff which always worked BEFORE they released an update. I also wonder what happens with all the money they earn through those microtransactions since they do not seem to invest it in improving their server infrastructure. That's poor for an game which is meant to be primarly being played online. Server performance / Netcode is poor and getting worse the bigger this game grows FPS drops which didn't exist back in 2015 having constant high FPS ingame doesn't lead to a smooth online gameplay experience at all input lag player has no control to tweak configuration filesCan't recommend to new players in 2018. Expect a toxic player community as well.

review: This is one of the most fun games you can play with at least 1 friend(you can play with more than 1 friend)Without further ado let's jump right into pros and cons PROSGameplay(very fun and addictive easy to learn hard to master)Graphics(game is no god of war or forza in terms of looks but the colors are nice and the cars have all nice details)Sound(most cars sound very good but there are a few that sound very generic and not interesting at all)Customization(great ammount of customization from wheels to decals to goal explosions and everything in between its very very nice)Mostly interesting and good value DLC(especially on sale) that doesnt alter the game in any way shape or form!Endless play time!A lot of gamemodes that keep you entertained for a long time!CONSSound(as i have stated above some cars sound kinda meh)Graphics(i would like a little bit more of antialiasing and maybe a better camera angle?)Very few bugs and netcode glitches(they are very rare but when they do occur they can annoy you and even ruin some matches that is especially infuriating when you play ranked)Toxic players(well this one comes as no surprise as it is very common in competitive videogames this one is no exception but note that there are way less toxic players compared to LOL DOTA or CS GO)Now a little TLDR If you like football and cars then this game is for you do pick it up with a few friends as it gets even funnier and crazier the graphics are nice and the game is in no way pay 2 win!That about does it guys thanks a lot for reading and if you would like to add anything or contest anything that i have said reply to my review and we'll talk.Also excuse my grammar mistakes as English is not my primary language have a good one!
title: Rocket League®

review: Really like this game 10/10 very well polished super fun to play even against AI.Just some quick suggestions for the devs...Menu scrolling it's a simple thing but being able to hit down from the lowest option on a menu and snap to the top is super useful.Peeling out not even for a speed boost although that would be fun and a very useful skill for goalies just the simple mechanic of being able to hold both triggers and spin the wheel would be awesome.EDIT Came back almost 1 000 hours later.Well into the top 2% of the playerbase my only suggestion for newcomers is to play with a friend. There's nothing more satisfying than getting that "Great pass!".Also the two things I suggested still aren't added but I'm no longer sure about the second one.

review: Rocket League is an example of a well made game. Want to play basketball of soccer but using cars? Here you go! This is one of those game like Minecraft that no matter what I always come back to it just to have a little fun. The maps are really good and have beautiful scenery (though I wish Aquadome didn't lag for me) and trying to get some goals with your teammates is always really fun especially when it get chaotic with everyone trying to get the ball. You still reading this review? Then go buy it. Now. $20 you will certainly not regret.November 2017 update The game is so good I'll be buying it again for Nintendo Switch. Rocket League is not a waste of money.November 2018 update I still play Rocket League a lot nowadays and yes I did buy the Nintendo Switch version as well. Loving the different holiday themed events where I can collect a whole bunch of items.

review: Constantly updating content easy to rank up in MMR once you're pretty good. The ranked MMR feels really balanced lower tiers will almost always have lower tier players which helps ALOT with learning curve. The only complaint though it's also a balancing thing is when I play with higher level friends we match against a team of their level but again that really helps with balancing so that someone doesn't just get carried into higher levels. Tbh I think the rank system is one of the best out there and even though it's not the most important thing in this game it definitely shows how well made it is.

review: Played over 2k hours on Xbox not as many on PC but still a great game. This is the basic fun enjoyable game to come back to when every other game you own starts seeming boring. This game never gets boring to me and there isnt much to complain about with this one. Sometimes the community can be toxic but you can easily mute the chat and your problem is solved. Plus with the training packages offered new players can jump right into training and start getting better right away. Great game 9/10.
title: Rocket League®

review: I have played numerous multiplayer games over the years yet no game has been as compelling as Rocket League. Rocket League is uncompromising in its difficulty but those who grit it out and develop the skillset required to be proficient in controlling the offered vehicles will experience a degree of satisfaction that few modern games can rival. Dribbling wallshots aerials etc. all feel precise due to the tremendous physics engine provided by Psyonix. The gameplay in and of itself encourages you to become better and experience everything the game has to offer. Hence for those on the fence about purchasing this game don't be. Rocket League is as fun as it is addicting.Edit The community has grown far too toxic for my taste. I replayed this game after a six month hiatus and despite the gameplay being rock solid there are far too many players willing to criticize and/or mock you for a variety of reasons ranging from your username to your dribbling skills. I want to play a game where I can devote my attention to the gameplay and actually enjoy my time as opposed to reading the distasteful comments of toxic players.Edit 2 The in game toxicity once prevalent in Rocket League has been reduced significantly by the devs therefore I am changing my review back to positive.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is one of those games that you can pick up at any point and just have a blast. All matches take about 5 minutes (Unless you end up in a Sudden death situation where nobody can score a goal) and each match you play takes skill and teamwork to win. There is a very high skill ceiling in this game with plenty of skill and teamwork to develop as you play but the game is very welcoming to casual players. Definitely plan on playing this game with others! I normally play in groups of three with friends and find myself shouting enthusiastically/laughing when we do things right or get lucky on a goal or save it's just a really rewarding experience.The only con I can think of is the in game voice chat. I rarely hear people use it and it normally sounds quiet/laggy when they do. It seems like in a team game this would be considered a serious issue but is one that is avoided by using the quick chat commands and discord. Otherwise this game is well worth.
title: Rocket League®

review: This review will be 2 fold. I love the game. Never played a game that well if you don't PRACTICE then you will for sure be stuck at the bottom. That aspect of the game makes Rocket League very unique. It is a Game that stresses team work even tho the majority of people that play it don't exactly understand what team work even is. The developers do some wierd things but all in all they are good about keeping the game as bug free as possible. The things I hate about the game. Mostly the community. There are some great people don't get me wrong but for the most part the immaturity level is very very low. The amount of rage you are capapble of seeing in just a few games is astounding. Sadly that does not just happen from the community. You can also see it when watching the pros stream. Basically if you love the idea of hitting a soccer ball with a car and making that car fly. This game is right up your alley. But if you get angered quick you might want to think about this purchase. Over all i give Rocket League a B+.

review: TLDR With the introduction of numerous cash grabbing tactics (i.e. Rocket pass and crates) the severe lack of "new content" (i.e. new stages gamemodes and other main features other than adding new paid or dlc items) and the exponentially increasing amount of bugs that surfaced in the past few months I feel that I cannot recommend Rocket League anymore... It is truly a shame that a game I would wholeheartedly recommend two years ago quickly turned into a game meant to squeeze money out of you left and right. Now don't get me wrong Rocket League is still extremely fun to play solo or with friends but with Psyonix's change of focus on paid customization items (that you can unlock by paying for 'keys' to open up 'crates' buying the dlc or paying for Rocket Pass) in newer updates I just really feel disgusted with these greedy developers...If you can get to ignore these annoyances then I am sure you will enjoy Rocket League either way. With its fun quirky controls and its simplistic hectic playstyle this game is easiy to pick up yet comprehensive to the core. At the same time you can play it in quicky bursts or even long play sessions without getting bored or fatigued. There is even casual or competitive gamemodes which allow the game to be played by any type of player.In the long run everyone has their own tastes. Even if I find paid customization items and various other things as a headache someone else might really like it. So by no means let this review steer you away from the game but rather give you some insight about the game so that you know what you are getting into. Since I've started playing two years ago the game has changed dramatically from monthly content updates (like new stages gamemodes and other quality of life improvements) to semiperiodic dull 'content updates' (like new crates paid dlc and the very rare occurance of a new stage or gamemode). So although the 'core' of the game still exists it is simply being sprinkled with bland updates that I feel are slowly ruining the game.
