review: This game is awesome!Rocket League is the result of a really dope concept combined with a masterful execution and is one of the main esports games out there due to its high skill ceiling as well as being so fun that you can enjoy it regardless of your skill level.The initial difficulty curve is quite high though but learning the controls comes naturally and the phrase "Practice makes perfect" becomes crucial. This means that in order to become great at it you need to put in a lot of time and effort. This isn't neccesarily a bad thing but something important to note for most people. Either way it can still be quite a lot of fun even if you aren't skilled at it!The thing is with this game though you have to be careful not to take it too seriously. This is both a casual and competetive game and one can easily slip into a negative mindset rather easily if things don't go too well. (See Tilting) Despite this however taking a break and trying to look at this with a mindset of playing for fun can really make a difference in whether or not you'll keep playing the game.I love this game but the players can sometimes be straight up asses. Don't worry though that's with every mutliplayer game. Just remember that this is meant to be fun and what other people say doesn't make a difference in the end and you'll be fine!I have a lot of hours in this game and for good reason too. It's really amazing seeing yourself progress and improve as you play and discover new techniques while breaking self created milestones.Also this game is beautiful. Downright glorious.All in all this game is worth it. Definitely.
title: Rocket League®

This game has alot to offer and i think the game is amazing so if ur still wondering about picking this game up u should just do it! (Sorry if my english was not the best &gt //&lt )

review: Picked this up for free on my PS4 and loved it! so much so I purchased it on Steam.I've never had any issues in regards to glitches or poor performance and the game is just fun as hell. Whether you're playing casual games of ice hockey basketball or rumble you're always going to have a good laugh and if you're looking for more serious competitive games you can go into the ranked modes (1v1 2v2 3v3 4v4).There are microtransactions but these are solely cosmetic only.Well worth a buy!2018 Still playing and loving this game
title: Rocket League®

review: Simple idea. Excellent execution.
title: Rocket League®

review: This is my favorite multiplayer game by hours played (1700 at this writing). This game has very few mechanical quirks at this point other than the beloved physics which have been unchanged since the beginning. The game very rarely crashes and the performance is fairly consistent which gives me great confidence in the engine when playing. I love opening the crates and I am happy to support the game in order to open them. This game is one where your skill "solidifies" as you take breaks from the game. I feel as if my ability is completely second nature and effortless but when I first started I was a mess. I really love how in awe of the skill this game made me feel. I felt motivated to achieve greater levels of skill in ways I had never enjoyed in a game. I typically am a casual gamer but I love playing competitive Rocket League.This game is a steal at any price because you rightly should put thousands of hours into it.
title: Rocket League®

review: Great gameplay lots of competitive players and lots of moments that make you inch forward in your seat toward the screen. Requires a fair amount of skill if you want to rank up to higher levels. Use the training mode in the menu to practice goalie shots striker shots and aerials. I personally find it easier using a controller. The customizability of cars gives everyone their unique personality. Diversity of maps make the game look nicer so it isn't so bland with the same map every game. Different modes allow for uncalled for moments and goals which is definitely seen in modes like Rumble and Dropshot. Other modes include 1v1 through 4v4 so you can play with or against friends. Crate system is okay I'm not into that type of stuff because it doesn't seem worth it to pay money for in game items. The only thing I dislike is the community. Whether the other team wins or loses they will always throw salty hate comments at you and leave the game. Other teams harass players and some are rarely seen sabotaging the match on purpose. Some players do actually say 'gg' and leave quietly without saying anything harsh. There's also the occasional chance you can play with or against Rocket League developers which is fun. Great price choice of $20 costs less if you want to buy some copies for your friends.TL DRAmazing game with diversity customizability and fun. Toxic community. Skill required.9/10.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is one of the most enjoyable games I've ever played. It's playable by a variety of age groups. There is room for both casual players looking for fun and laughs and there is also a very competitive scene for people looking to grind through the ranks. The skill ceiling is high and it takes some time to get used to the mechanics but the game provides hundreds of hours of entertainment to a wide audience.

review: This is the most flawed toxic game you could ever have the misfortune of playing. Unless you are amazingly talented at it or have a team of friends instead of random team mates. Otherwise you will never be able to progress due to the appalling matchmaking. It ranges from the ridiculous to the sublime one minute someone is carrying you with air dribbles the next your team mate can hardly judge the ball. Once the crates came in well that was the end of it as there is seemingly an endless number of people only worried about items rather than actually playing the game. In a nutshell this game has made me hate gaming hate society and my life. Do yourself a favour and avoid it at all costs.

I played as a Silver then i started playing Rocket League on Ps4 but then when I got my new PC I bought Rocket League and started to learn from there by looking on tutorials and by watching the pros play in tournaments and in the Rocket League Championship Series (RLCS). My favorite team in RLCS is C9C9 is a trong team and i like their formation that are standing Gimmick SquishyMuffinz and Torment. They have a great chemistry and a good defence of play they rotate good and their passes are insane. I like Squishy most because he has great talent that inspiring every player on the field he creates opportunity and he have learned his skills all by himself.I rate this game 10/10 and I recommend this game because it is really fun when you are good as a champ )

review: (skip to the bottom of the page for an actual review)10 rare octane decals (that I already have) from crates out of 10 would get ranked against players significantly better than me for no reason whatsoever again. It's such a good game I wrote a short and descriptive essay just now about the game.So you're gonna get this cool game you saw on the internet because your favorite youtuber made a video about it in 2014. I'd like to give you a quick all you need to know in one guide to this magnificent game Casual is pretty casual when you're not getting cussed out by the enemy team or getting a 7 game losing streak. When I first started playing competetive I was like "Wow cool! A bunch of players that are better than me and oh my teammate left after they scored once cool." And then it got better so that my teammates wouldn't randomly leave and I was like "Wow cool! A teammate that is ranked in silver doubles like me! Maybe he'll be really good and oh he own goaled again cool. It's 2 7 now and we have 14 seconds left awesome!" So I stopped playing competetive as much unless if I felt really freakin amazing at the game after warming up. Then I'd go down 4 divisions in 30 minitues and write this review. But the graphics and gameplay are pretty cool. The devs are dilligent and are always adding cool new crap creating awesome special events to get limited stuff that literally everyone else has ignoring the ranking system issues and giving you free useless crates which costs 149 beautiful priceless pennies to open a singular box of poo instead of that one cool hat or boost effect you've been wanting. But it's OK because I have a bunch of friends that get me $20 steam gift cards and crap for my birthday. Here's some detailed instructions on how to open a crate Buy some keys in a pack so they're cheaper open the crate and say "WOW! I got another octane ZSR or whatever decal to add to my collection of untradable garbage rare items!" Then you repeat this exact same process with every key you have left until the $20 Steam gift card your friend gave you have has gone to complete waste but hey there's a chance you might get that cool octane ZSR or whatever that looks exactly like the default octane from afar and then you'll be able to use all the cool decals that look like abstract art from any more than 10 feet away. So you got maybe let's say one cool import car from the 37 crates you opened. Awesome! There's really no downside to that exept if you suck once and your teammate cusses you out for "having cool stuff but acting like a noob" but it's fine because it only says you're a pro on your rank. That means the only people you'll get ranked against are noobs like masters legends and freaking rocketeers so there's really nothing to worry about. The trading system is pretty cool. You can take 5 priceless uncommon hats to get a freaking fedora or you can trade in the 5 rare octane ZSR or whatever decals to get a very rare one and oh what's this? "Trading in this object will result in a non tradable even crappier object!" Hmm... That seems fine to me guess I'll just oh you can't trade decals from different collections? Well I'll just go play some games to earn more XP that literally does nothing but give you harder opponents that do ariels faster and better than you and useless crates that promise cool stuff but end up giving you wheels which are significantly worse than your current set.In all seriousness this is a truly mouthwatering salad with chicken. I would recommend this appetizing cheese quesadilla to literally anyone as it is my all time favorite luscious ham and cheddar sandwich and that's coming from a guy who has hardly even played this savory steak meal compared to most people. The gameplay is tasty the physics are delicious the graphics are scrumptious the devs are very well done and they release flavorful patches and new spicy events pretty quickly. If this game were a beverage it would be banned because it's so freaking addicting and overall exquisitely pleasing to the taste buds. Just buy the game already it's worth more than a turkey dinner at your grandma's house.
title: Rocket League®

review: The ranking system is so bad. At the start of every season u can't win. Let's say you're just a beginner with a bronze rank in the previous season when the new season comes for the first many days you can't play ranked because of everyone being the same rank. It's just awful. You can literally play against someone that was platinum in the previous season and get beaten every time. I don't see the point of a a completely new rank after every season. The game is good and fun to play with friends but 1v1 is too imposibble to play in ranked if you have recently just started.P.S. If you are gonna be saying that ''Then don't play 1v1'' playing 2v2 with a random player is just as bad. If you have friends to play it with great. If not then good luck and try to play as much training as you can but I hope the ranking system could change a little to help the new guys.

review: This game is great even for those who don't like sports games. Yes even though rocket league is soccer with bumper cars a lot of people who tell me they aren't into sports games say they love rocket league. Some mechanics take a little bit of time to learn and even longer to master especially as you progress towards higher ranks. But most can agree that no matter how many hours you play nothing is most satisfying than sinking a complex or calculated goal. This game has a great single player option but I'd highly recommend playing with friends. Also kudos to Psyonix for cross platform gameplay.

review: Easily my favourite esports game. Tight responsive controls limitless technical creativity satisfying gameplay.It's like playing soccer when you're a kid you start off being able to barely think of anything besides "MUST HIT BALL". You can barely shoot. Nobody wants to defend. Passing? lol.But then you learn. You realize that not every touch is a good idea. Your coordination improves. You get better at hitting the ball and even eventually aiming it. You realize that you can influence the game without touching the ball stealing boost from your opponents and demoing them. You start being able to control the ball. You pass the ball to create a better chance. You get in a posistion to score instead of chasing the ball. You've finally mastered the fundementals.You improve your advanced mechanics and you climb. It's wonderful. There is no better feeling in the world. And then you get 15 straight games with garbage teammates and demote back to Gold 3. this game
title: Rocket League®

review: How do i say it? The game good depends on where you live and what style play. If your in the EU gl hf because the servers are dead trash. I (live in england) have better ping in na around 70 than eu (at least 140) . Im not so domb to say oh yeah this games trash cause servers are bad or all . Neither would i say that you need to put all your team on servers as not everyone knows how to format network code. But seriously me and my friend have played this game for ages (me 800+ hours and my friend near 2000) and when we started (season 3) this game had no network problem. I think personally that the implement of items has put a load on the servers as they have to exchange more data to keep track of the cars visuals. Eu servers need a fix. Except that the game is fine.

review: This is one of those rare games that I have 100% loved from my very first game to my most recent. Rocket League has always been a very consistent game with developers that listen to the community and continue to provide updates on a regular basis. I played Rocket League on PS4 back when it first released and loved it so much I had to buy it again when I switched to PC gaming. The newest Rocket Pass has added a fun sidebar to the game although I think they could improve it by adding daily or weekly challenges. Right now it's just a matter of playing enough matches and earning enough XP to level up your Rocket Pass. I think adding "challenges" like "Score 3 goals" or "Center 5 balls" would add more incentive for players to grind for the next Rocket Pass tier.

review: one of the best game of the last years. I still cant believe that this game brought me so much joy and funny/epic moments with such a simple game idea . Absolute amazingi would go so far to call it the best E sport game ever.Pros absolutely no pay to win incredible amount of car design possibilities smooth gameplay unlimited skill ceiling awesome E sport tournaments very active devs awesome player base ( most of the time ) and many more . too much to list rn. ( and believe it or not the support is incredibly fast ) Cons??? there are not really any downsides but there are some things that are pretty annoyingthings like unreliable servers ( you get a bad server around every 30 50 games ) you have to have a good ping to play normal and a minority of salty players . Also you can get pretty angry if you loose. i once even smashed my controller at my wall .Rocket league is truly a masterpiece. I have around 3000h on Pc and Ps4 and it never gets boring. if you have a bad day at RL or think ur bad just dont let yourself down and keep calm its calculated .THIS IS ROCKET LEAGUE

review: OverviewRocket League is the perfect example of a simple idea executed the correct way. It doesn t need complex progression or diverse player choices to keep it fun it s just fun as it is. You ve got fast rocket powered cars that can jump or fly around and you use them to knock a ball into your opponent s goal. That s all there is to the core gamemode. It is so rare these days that a game with an idea this basic actually ends up being a fully fledged successful title. Rocket League is a great change of pace and it has earned a lot of respect from me. Rocket League s main gamemode Soccar as Psyonix likes to call it is certainly a simple idea that anyone can get into but it is in no way easy. The controls in this game are easy to learn they work well and are fluid but learning how to properly maneuver your vehicle in order to hit a moving ball at the right angle to get it to go where you want is another story entirely. If you re playing Rocket League you ve likely played other racing games and understand the basics but controlling a car in this manner is an incredibly unique experience. Even people who have hundreds of hours in ranked played still fail to properly control their car as they re flying through the air. It is definitely a game that encompasses the idea of easy to learn hard to master. While the standard Soccar gamemode is certainly the most well known and commonly played it isn t actually the only thing Rocket League has to offer. First I should note that Soccar does have some slight variants including 1v1 2v2 3v3 as well as ranked versions of each. The game has always had a solid competitive scene so if that s your thing this is a good place for it. There are sorts of other less serious gamemodes as well. As Psyonix comes up with more fun things to do with rocket cars I m sure we ll see even more added or rotated in. Currently there are Hockey and Basketball modes which play much like how you d imagine they would with fast cars. There is also a chaotic 4v4 Soccar mode a mode revolving around cooldown based powerups that can do crazy things like teleport switching with an enemy or summoning a tornado to toss the ball and other cars around. GameplayRocket League is a fast paced sports/racing game where quick reactions and planning are essential. Personally I am not a big fan of most racing games and practically no sports games however Rocket League really earns its own different place around those genres. I would highly recommend just checking out a video or two from professional Rocket League tournaments it should be quick to notice how some people are so passionate about playing and watching this game. If you re not the competitive type Rocket League still certainly has plenty to offer you. Either playing with friends in casual matches or privates matches against one another is an immense amount of fun. That can be said about many games but you aren t going to find another game like this out there right now. It should also be noted that this is one of the very few games out there that supports cross platform matchmaking and parties. It doesn t work between every possible combination of platforms but it does with most of the following PC PS4 Xbox One and the Switch. GraphicsThe arenas in which you play in are all relatively small this is not an open world game. For this reason they are able to implement absolutely gorgeous arenas and backdrops while still maintaining very good performance across most computers. As time goes on Psyonix continues to add more beautifully themed maps all of which essentially play out the same but add some pleasant variety that make each match just that much more interesting. The maps aren t the only beautiful thing they certainly didn t want their rocket cars to get jealous of their environment. All the different cars perform practically the same with only some slight difference in hitbox and handling. However there are such a wide amount of options that most anyone should be able to find one that they love to look at. There are many free or paid cosmetic options for car bodies wheels cute hats or even things like boost trails or goal explosions!User InterfaceThe UI is as sleek and sexy as the rest of the game. Psyonix continues to make improvements to it but it has always been very well designed. It s easy and fast to get into whichever kind of match you d like. You can see news and patch notes ingame and also easily see which song the ingame playlist is currently on. ControlsI believe most people would prefer to play this with a controller and that s surely what it s mainly designed for. However I have always played on Mouse and Keyboard and I ve never felt the controls to be awkward or difficult. Everything is easily rebindable as well on either control scheme. AudioCar engines roaring crowds cheering goal horns blaring what s not to love? All of the expected sound effects of a rocket powered soccer game are here and they are quite satisfying. There are even some options for different engine or boost sounds for your car. Most of the music of Rocket League consists of EDM and other fast paced electronic style music which is of course very fitting for the aesthetic of the game. The game has some solid original songs as well as an increasingly large amount of options for other indie groups that fit into the game equally as well. In 2017 Monstercat also partnered with Psyonix allowing Rocket League to feature their new songs ingame via their very convenient Rocket League Radio .Final ThoughtsRocket League is a game as much as it is a show. The style and implementation of the game allows for it to be a very strong esport due to the high skill ceiling and the excitement of watching it. As competitive as it gets it also has plenty of fun to be had for even the most casual gamers out there. It s an incredibly unique game and really stands alone outside of games from the same genres. This is the type of game that really will just come to someone s personal preference of whether they will play it or not. It isn t held back in any way by performance or catering to only a specific audience it s truly a game I believe that anybody can love.If you have the time please consider checking out my Patreon!

review: TL DR Great game! Overall 8.5/10 Community 7/10 Graphics 8/10 Customization 9/10 Easy to learn hard to master You'll start getting basic mechanics after 10 20 hours of play but then soon realize that you know absolutely nothing when you see people flying in the air doing trick shots. This is either a huge plus or minus for people. If you have the dedication required to get good than you won't find yourself lacking. If you want to immediatelly have the game mastered then this isn't for you. At the same time if you don't want the pressure of playing online with others than you can always hit up the singleplayer against AI. Though I will say the AI is lacking severely in my opinion and is only good if you don't care much about a competitive experience. Generally play on easy for other games? Singleplayer is for you. Community is hit or miss when it comes to either trolls or kind fellows. One game your teamates and fellow competitive enemies are great the next both are constantly flaming or simply insulting you for the car that you use. Having a friend to play with offers the best experience and is really how the game is meant to be played. While I have found a few gems when it comes to online friends that's exactly what they are. Gems. Don't expect fantastic or easy going people every match. If this is your attitude than you'll get along with most just fine. All in all a 7/10 community so far for me. Graphics are on point for this style of game. While it's nothing to write home about when compared to AAA titles it's fantastic for the what the game actually is. Each map is a very small arena so performance wise it doesn't take a super computer to run this thing which is a plus regardless of your hardware. Most of the time you won't notice it since you're so focused on the gameplay but the backgrounds to each of the maps are well thought out and sometimes even funny. Watching little blobs jumping up and down cheering you on is always a plus xD. Each map is diversified enough that it keeps it interesting. You'll see anything from a Japanese sci fi to a California beach theme. The cars and customization options for them are also well designed. 8/10 overall. Customization is the real end game to Rocket League (don't me). There are tons and when I say tons I mean TONS of options here. Cars trails boost wheels paint jobs colors antennas engine sounds and more. Each of these categories has hundreds of things to choose from and makes every player you meet that much more interesting. A lot of times you can tell who you're playing with without even having to see their name. Only downside is a lot of the really cool things are locked behind a crate system. Luckily this is only for high rarity cosmetics and even then if you play long enough you can still get it through trading in game. I'd give it a 9/10

review: Rocket League is fun and very addicting. The gameplay is simple and straightforward you are a car with the ability to jump fly and flip towards a ball or puck that you must put into the opposing team's goal. This seems simple enough but once other players are added to the game (teammates included) there is a high potential for chaos. Communication is key and because of that I recommend playing with a few friends over Discord. If you have to play with random players learn your quick chat hot keys and be flexible.

review: One of the funnest games I have played in a long while. The cars are designed to be close enough to one another balance wise that you can do well with any car if you put the time in. The gameplay is smooth animation is clean sounds are distinct and the arenas are all unique visually.Extra gamemodes like Hoops and Snow Day allow for a bit of added flavor to the regular soccar gamemode. Hoops is basketball with a smaller arena and slightly heavier ball weight and Snow Day is regular Rocket League but it's hockey.Psyonix has special events during the year allowing players to get exclusive items using tokens gained by playing matches. The lifespan of tokens lasts longer than the actual event which is nice if you have a ton of tokens left to use.The game is easy to pick up hard to master. It looks simple enough to hit the ball with your car until you're actually behind the wheel. But it becomes easier as you play more and more. And as you play more and more you gain skills that you either find by accident or by watching higher skilled players perform.Overall I highly recommend this game to anyone who is still on the fence. It's an amazing game for a good price compared to other titles. $20 normally $10 when on sale when some other games can charge upwards of $40 normally.Seriously though buy this game.
title: Rocket League®

review: Fun game but to matchmaking is horrible. People with really high ranks buy new cheap accounts to play with friends of low levels just to throttle others and carry their friends. This is done because the highest ranked player dictates the level difficulty of a match rather than the average of the players involved. Its a broken system but there are moments of fun that can be had still. However if you aren't reporting at least 1 person every 10 matches or less then you aren't experiencing the true toxic nature of the player base. Foturnately there are many ways to report this although the punishments seem minimal. Even with these issues it remains a fun game especially with family and friends.

review: If you've stayed away from Rocket League all this time because you don't like sports games you are making a mistake. Although the main gameplay revolves around hitting a ball into a goalpost the sheer amount of variety possible in accomplishing that the skill required and of course the fact that you are a rocket car puts the game in its own genre. You may have seen videos of top tier plays which may be intimidating but the presence of ranked games helps to ensure that all players can go against others at a similar skill level. Even back when I just started and could barely pull off basic moves I still felt this game was a blast the entire time. Do yourself a favour and play this game.

review: Ball. Cars. Try to score a goal.At it's core that's what the majority of Rocket League is about. The game has several game modes that each have their own quirks and enjoyment from the classic Soccar to the tactical Dropshot. Really funny game if you want to just play casually simply chasing the ball around and blowing up other cars is very enjoyable even against bots. Customization is a definite plus as there is a ton of items to choose from.Competitively it's all about raw skill and situational awareness though mostly because everything you can equip on the cars is purely cosmetic and so the only thing that makes a slight difference is the car's Frame that will have a differently sized hitbox. This results in a game with a very high skill cap and steep learning curve. Some of the pros are able to pull insane moves that make it seem like they are playing an entirely different game. The good news is that they are more than willing to share explanations and strategies on how to improve at the game so there is always something new to learn even after hundreds of hours of playtime. Unfortunately not everyone has that same attitude so you better prepare yourself for some of the saltiest game sessions you could experience. Most of the vocal part of the community is little kids angry at the developers because they won't tailor to their every whim and having petty disputes with each other but thankfully you can simply disable chat through the Options menu. Trust me it's a healthy choice.There are also locked loot crates that you can buy Keys for with real currency and also a Tiered reward system called Rocket Pass that you can get into by spending Keys after which you unlock exclusive items as you level up during the period it is active. All of it is entirely cosmetic for the looks of your car and therefore it is completely optional to the point that the system can also be hidden through the options if that's not your cup of tea.Overall definitely recommend this game.
title: Rocket League®

review: Been playing this game on and off since it came out.I'm not really a fan of soccer games but I quickly found this game's concept to be original fun &amp creative with great multiplayer (for playing local/online co op with friends or just online).I also really like the fact that you can hop in and out of a game easily which is great if you only have a few minutes to squeeze in a round or 2 of gameplay since each game only lasts about 5 min. In regards to skill level this may be off putting for some but I like a good challenge and really feel that I've improved dramatically since I first started which you'll quickly find encouraging as time goes on.Just be be warned that many people take this game way too seriously and the community is really toxic as a result. Finally if you're looking to get serious with this game be aware that solo queueing in competitive matchmaking is also really bad so make sure you have a reliable friend(s) on your side if you want to build up your rank.

review: Rocket League didn't grab me right at the start. I found the learning curve just that too steep to be anything other than embarrassingly horrendous in any form of multiplayer game. Own goals would be scored teammates would be side swiped and my desire would be to log out and forget this game ever appeared in my backlog.But then it happened. Everything just clicked. Yes it took a good few hours to really get to grips with (in my incredibly low level way anyway) how my vehicle maneuvers and how each little prod of the throttle and tweak of the steering wheel will push that oversized ball in a direction of my choosing but I got there. Soon I was creating chances for my team(s) every thirty seconds or so judging how the ball will fly if I hit it exactly just right and how it'll rebound off that angled wall. I even started to prejudge how one of my teammates will attack the ball in a few seconds time allowing me to get myself set up for a hopeful attempt on goal.Helpfully getting through the hours of that learning slog is made more pleasant by a surprisingly decent community. Well if you avoid Ranked mode when you're anything below 'Pro' level anyway. Wander in as a Rookie or Semi Pro and the abuse will begin as soon as the first goal is conceded. A well taken goal will be praised as such and a perfectly judged assist will be called out too. Even amazing saves will tend to get a 'Well Done' as opposed to accusations of cheating that permeate through the likes of FIFA. Obviously your millage may vary and I've certainly not entirely missed any suggestions of a toxic community but now you can quickly and easily report and block the worst offenders life is a whole lot more pleasant.Rocket League even manages to be an entirely surprisingly attractive game. Hook up a 4K screen and things really do look absolutely stunning. And move at a cracking frame rate with everything turned to max on a somewhat aging desktop. My old i5 2500k/1070 combo was enough for 4k gaming and it's made my gaming world only that little bit even sweeter.Even though I continue to be pretty rubbish and I still can't get the handle of using my boost to reach balls that are out of reach of a standard leap I bloody love playing Rocket League. Whether it be just one 5 minute game or a handful of hours spent blitzing my way to glory even the most frustrating moments have handed over some kind of joy. Way more than any standard sporting game has over the last half a decade at least.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a survival horror game inwhich you are thrown into a soccer arena forced to fight against the hundreds of drones that only refer to themselves as the "Octanes." The game's main method of defending against the Octane drones are to play car soccer and score into their net. You may blow up your opponents but they will respawn after a few seconds. You may sometimes play against other opponents who are not Octanes but these are quite uncommon due to the influence of the Octane drones and their abilities to flood matchmaking. Aside from the story mode involving Octane drones the gameplay of this game is pretty good. 10/10 would hit the rim again.

review: Rocket League is an addictive game. When playing with ball cam on (this means the ball is always in the center of the screen despite driving anywhere AND the ball moving anywhere) the player has to deal with any situation from all angles. On top of that the controls for flight allow the player to move in a similar sort of way rotating to any angle to hit the ball. That's not easy.But Rocket League is not a perfect game nor is it close to being perfect. Matchmaking is generally unfair some players are very unpleasant and they will totally let you know that people are reporting players left right and center for being too bad or too good or just because they feel like it there's a good chunk of luck never mind bullsh it in generally whatever happens leaving the game thinking "WTF was that" and "I need to quit this game"Overall I rate this game as a waste of time as there's an infinite learning curve.

review: This game is enraging. so you get your rank gold and you're happy. youve finaly done it. youre out of silver (because you used to be crap). you worked hard to get out of silver last season. and youre confident. you hop in another match. you score 4 goals with 2 minutes left. YOU HAVE THIS WIN. then all of a sudden out of nowhere. opposition scores 5 goals. the timer is on 5 seconds. opposition is out of position the goal is open. you take the shot. "ITS FREE REALESTATE". then in flies your team mate at 3175342654mp/h trying to stea the shot misses by half the didtance to the moon and back and you loose. DIVISION down. im back to silver. i get mad at team mate. tema says i was going to miss. but deep down i had confidence. i knew i had it i knew we wouldve forved over time. i knew we wouldve won....... but no for alas. IM STILL ING SILVER. i give 8/8 gg

review: I oculdn't think of a review so here's a recipe for blueberry muffins instead Heat oven to 375 .Grease 18 regular size muffin cups (or 12 large size muffins).In bowl mix butter until creamy. Add sugar and beat until pale and fluffy.Add eggs one at a time beating after each.Beat in vanilla baking powder and salt.With spoon fold in half of flour then half of milk into batter repeat.Fold in blueberries.Spoon into muffin cups and sprinkle topping onto each muffin.Bake 15 to 20 minutes until golden brown and springy to touch.

review: The most frustrating experiences of my life come through this game but equally so too do the most rewarding ones. This game is great for casual players with friends looking for fun but also great for competitive gamers wanting a challenge. Ranked is the worst thing known to man if you actually start to care about it. I wouldn't advise that. Just focus on improving your own game and enjoying yourself that's how I eventually managed to hit champion. Probably a solid 9/10 runs well (recommend lowering settings for higher FPS) looks and feels great most of the time and can be such a chilled out or equally intense game to participate in. Peace

review: Really fun game downsides are that the servers aren't the best and the game has some bugs nothing game breaking though. The matches usually have 5 minutes (to around 6 minutes if you go overtime) so if you want to play quick matches between some other activity I find Rocket League one of the best options around (quitting a casual match isn't as punishing as other games as well it's not even punished here). The community is quite toxic in LATAM (Latin America) but that's unavoidable in online games just mute the chat and play if that bothers you.

review: Flying cars and giant soccer balls. Nuff said.Edit 2/28/17People keep telling me I should at least... at LEAST!!... rising star. I'm not. I can't because someone always has random high ping. Sometimes it's me. Sometimes it's my team mate. Sometimes it the opponent. When it's the opponent it's an instant win and I apologize. But when it's a roulette spin that often rolls onto me I feel like it's hopeless... all of it.... not just getting to rising star... but getting to my ultimate dream of being the best there ever was. I've got the game on Steam and PS4. I've bought keys. Psyonix has made enough money to invest in halfway decent servers. I'm still going to give this a thumbs up... but damn if I'm not that I won't be getting those sexy blue wheels.Update 11/26/18 The game still lags. Still has a thumbs up from me.

review: Rocket League is a really great game for both casuals and hardcores. With its simple goals get the ball to the opponents goal being the core meaning of this rocket fueled football experience. The game also features a massive skill ceiling I observe no players being close to reaching yet even the very best. They still find new tricks and new ways to speed up and improve their gameplay.The game features a very great matchmaking system which feels like it actually has enough ranks to get people where they belong. In the top 2 ranks there is only about 0.5% of the player count. So you actually must be a great player to get the best ranks.

review: Below you will read my initial review....However I have cahnged my viewpoint from a positive to a negative... I would say 60 70% of games run like this....Game eventually starts 1 team scores 1 member from other team leaves. That makes it 2v3.... It quickly turns to 1v3 and bam game is lost.The only punishment for quitting appears to be being unable to matchmake for 15 minutes....For a game that thinks it is competition class.... it falls far short of this and you end up wasting more time trying to find a full game to completion than actually playing a good game.3/10 old review sceptical at first but the game has grown on me once I have fiddled with the various viewpoint options to take it away form looking like an oversized console game.This is fun frantic and with the dubstep music playing throughout will have you wanting more.My only gripe with it is the match making which can take up to 5 minutes to get a game plus in ranked more often than not there is a quitter an also no boost from someone leaving which can see you winning the game 3v3 to losing 2v3....Overall its demolition derby mixed with football and rc cars.8/10

review: Despite coming out over 3 years ago Rocket League is one of the few games that I find myself coming back to time and time again. Even more so I'm coming back to it more seriously than ever with the desire to become an exceptional player. If you have even the slightest bit of a liking for competitive play Rocket League will be a blast to you. This game is the closest thing to a sport than any other game out there and it allows you to practice it like you would a real sport. Whether you like to play this game seriously and competitively or play for fun against bots and set up whacky modifiers in private matches with your friends Rocket League will keep you entertained and keep you wanting to get better and better at it.

review: Simple to understand at first but very hard to master. You can have fun at all levels of play whether that be playing rumble or hoops with friends or jumping into competitive playlists to get your fix of standardised 3v3 2v2 and 1v1. Very solid physics model that feels intuitive (most of the time) and isn't too hard on your system. Also if the standard game modes aren't enough there are plenty of community made maps/gamemodes to satisfy your hunger for something out of the ordinary. Overall a very well polished game with bundles of potential for fun to be had. (p.s. this better win the category I nominated it for in the Steam Awards).

review: Rocket league is an amazing game for many reasons. They combine a driving game with soccer which is something you would never think of. Rocket League is a great game to either relax after a long day or go full competitive if that's how you like it. The game physics are done very well and the game is optimized nicely for lower end computers. I could get lost in Rocket League for hours and not get bored at all. Many people say that the game gets repetitive and it does at some point but as you climb the rank ladder you discover more skills and playstyles. The game has seasons which pushes you to keep the grind along with special events that allow you to unlock special items. In game items on rocket league are amazing and most of the are well priced in the trading community. One issue I found with the trading community is nobody does it for fun everyone trades to profit which means it can be frustrating to look for the item you want at market price. Using a controller is strongly reccomended but I know many people who are good at the game who use a keyboard and mouse. Overall the game is 100% worth it and most of you will be satisfied which your purchase.
title: Rocket League®

review: A simple challenge from Top Gear might have been the inspiration of this game but the game developed into something more than just ramming a ball to a goalie. The easy to pick up hard to master mechanics is one of the main keys to create a competitive game with a high skill ceiling. However this game did not only captured the eyes of many because how complex the game is. It established a successful e sport scene with the help of the developers in three years and it is still going strong. By 2018 the game had six seasons of their championship under the name "Rocket League Championship Series" and the recent event had a prize pool of a million dollar. As a comparison it took four years for CSGO to make a six figure prize pool for their tournament and CSGO was arguably more popular than rocket league in 2016.This game is not without problems from the developers and the community themselves however. Some of the veterans had probably encounter some game breaking glitches over the past few years and the servers have not been entirely stable since it came out (although numbers of fixes has been made). While it is true that the community is deemed to be toxic by many there are always a bad side in every competitive games out there. So if people are looking for a great game with a mechanic so complex that makes them intrigued to keep on learning as well as trying to compete for their championship yet able ignore the toxicity and some hiccups from Psyonix this game is a must have.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket league is a fun and fast paced driving game that combines vehicles and sports in an odd but extremly satisfying way. The game is easy to learn but it can be a challenge to become good at. Rocket League combines elements of sillyness and competivness in one package making it extremly fun to play with friends or even online with random players. Online players tend to have great sportsmanship unlike alot of other competitive games. The game features great and fitting soundtracks that will pump you up for the next game of Soccar (Football) Snow day (Hockey) Rumble and hoops which is much like basketball.
title: Rocket League®

review: Good support goes a long way and the guys at Psyonix seem to be following through on that. Consistent updates keeps players looking forward to the next grab. Good amount of focus on pro level and us regulars. The gameplay is extremely fun and fast paced. It is easy to get into the game but INCREDIBLY difficult to master which leads to a very satisfying progression in skill as you play. Rocket Leagues ranking system is one of the better ones. Rarely do I find teamed up with people who feel like they don't belong though it does happen it is a lot more rare than I have experienced in other games. The gameplay is unbelievably polished though there is a caveat and that is the vehicles. Truthfully Psyonix is trying to work on this problem and I think they may have it figured out soon but at the current time there are only a few vehicles that people actually use despite the vast amount of selection. Not to say that there are any complete garbage vehicles just the best ones are played by everyone at the higher tiers.The above is a minor issue and really one of the few "problems" I can think of about the game. The rest is golden. If you like fast paced gaming then this is a good bet for you especially if you have a bent toward racing games. Warning it has a high skill cap so you're rank placement games will probably feel like your getting pummeled. Once your rank is determined this shouldn't occur (unless of course you get carried by someone better than you through your matches in which case then you will drop in rank for a bit before stabilizing).
title: Rocket League®

review: Do you like cars? Do you like Football? Well it doesn't matter what your answer is you will probably love this game. The refreshing silly gameplay of Rocket League breaks away from most modern games trying to be extremely competitive or realistic and just offers fun in a simple form of remote controlled toy cars hitting a relatively giant ball. In addition to the usual chaos that may be expected from just playing a normal round with some friends or stranger there is also a competitive edge to the game. There is a ranking system that allows one to feel a sense of pride while ascending the ranks of Rocket League. Overall the game is enjoyable as a relaxing game where you laugh at how terrible your friends are or can be played with intent to be the very best remote controlled car football player ever.Did I mention you can also unlock different cars and customise them...Rating 8/10
title: Rocket League®

review: I would like to start by saying that I discovered Rocket League this year but it quickly became one of my favourite game. It's such a good game to play with friends ( I can't really recommend it without them). The mechanics are not the easiest to learn and there will be times when a team comes and just destroys you but believe me it makes the game more fun.The soundtrack of is good and it gives rhythm to the game and even though I usually don't listen to this type of games I can enjoy it while playing.The graphics of the game are good normal I would say they are not jaw dropping but neither unplayable.The microtransactions are there but they don't really influence the game maybe there are a few cars with better hit boxes but the difference won't mean much on a lower level.I can't really find any cons so I'm going to give a 9/10 ( it just needs a little bit more to become a perfect Game).

review: Rocket League has to be one of the most oddly addicting games for me. I personally am not a fan of competitive games I play most for fun. But theres a competitive itch and this game definitely scratches it! Definitely more fun with friends (good ones) but matchmaking will do a good job at matching you with same skill players. I am currently a low level and un ranked and get matched with other players with terrible aim and depth perception. The Cross play capability in this game is the best I've experienced matchmaking takes seconds. The tutorials are great for practice and the Steam Workshop allows for custom maps to be instantly enjoyed. This is a perfect game through and through. I can't believe I put off buying it for so long.I have terrible depth perception.

review: My playtime says it all but I have some very important remarks to makeThis game has some fantastic physics letting you pull off some incredible tricks and making it a great multiplayer matchmaking online experience. I spent hours playing four seasons of Rocket League and I had a lot of fun with the Competitive and Casual modes.However I am going to criticize some choices regarding the matchmaking and the crate unlocking systems. The matchmaking system is very inconsistent. I spent the majority of my playtime in Standard Gold III and oh boy I played in lots of crazy matches with own goals left right and everywhere and unimaginable whiffs. Granted I'm not the pinnacle of Rocket League skills but I at least learned how to rotate and rotation was what made me reach Gold III and ironically made me get stuck in Gold III. If you want to be promoted further I give you two choices find a party to play with or start grinding skills like a madman. I highly recommend the former option because the latter is only recommended for those who want to go for e sports and I am pretty sure you have lots more games than Rocket League.The Crate unlocking system is pretty inconsistent as well. You see It doesn't matter if you buy keys or earn decryptors for free the roulette will have always the same random chances of giving you items. The difference between keys and decryptors is that the items you get with decryptors you can't trade with other players. My question is Why? The guy who bought the key is already having an instant opportunity to get an item while the guy who goes for decryptors have to sporadically get one through playtime. I think this kind of design choice discourage trading.And now let's address the big elephant in the room the in game online community. When I was being promoted from Bronze I until Silver III I had very few instances of toxic people and I was also able to do some friends. Heck there was this guy who gently recommended me to learn about rotation it was wonderful time. However starting from Gold I things got very chaotic and I became toxic myself through ironic "Nice Shot!" and "What a Save!" Quick chat messages. I am very ashamed of what I have done. So again if you are going to play Competitive I highly recommend finding friends to play with. Unfortunately you can't make crossplatforms parties which Psyonix is supposedly working through Rocket ID (which is being delayed constantly don't count on it) only Steam parties are possible.In conclusion wonderful game questionable matchmaking system and crate unlocking toxic community proportional to rank. If you want to experience it I also recommend starting with Casual before going to Competitive.
title: Rocket League®

review: It is a great game you can play singleplayer with bots multiplayer casual or competitive multiplayer. There are some cool modes for multiplayer (rumble hoops...). In rumble for example you get a power up every 10 seconds with the boot power up you can kick a player away... It is a great game it is not pay to win but you can buy some cars that are from famous movies other games... Personally I bought the batman car because it has a large surface so there is more chance that you hit the ball. There is also trading so you can buy wheels cars decals... The main currency are keys which can be bought or you can trade items to get them. I recommend this game 10/10. You may want to wait for a sale and purchase another car.

review: Steep learning curve but so satisfying to learn new things. I'm old af (41) so I don't learn as quick as the kids but there's custom training packs created by others who have the same mechanics problems as me and it's possible to learn and get better through practice. Natural ability and youth seems to be the way to go but there's still a chance for us adults lol. As a casual the game can be frustrating meaning you'll miss the ball a LOT at first but keep at it and you'll start making easy hits on the ground. Then on the wall. Then in the air. Then off the ceiling. 3k+ hours and still so many things to figure out...Only issue I have is sometimes the servers are terrible. They'll lag random people there will be stutters in game play and of course WHERE'S MY DANG CROSS PLATFORM PARTY SYSTEM SONY????? I know it's not Psyonix's fault but they should've let Sony go the way of the Betamax. Once the cross platform party thing happens I'll forgive the sometimes crappy servers.

review: I burn out easily on just about every game I pick up and save Smash Brothers Rocket League is the only game I've ever had so much fun with and felt compelled to really hone my skills. The results translate for every technique I master my game improves. And three years later I've still got a lot of work to do. The skill ceiling is ridiculously high but the feeling of accomplishment is truly satisfying. It even demonstrated that I can use those tests of patience and practice to hone other crafts like learning instruments I've had sitting in my closet for years.I only have two gripes some members of the community (as in most games) are really toxic and the 'report' feature feels really futile. Also the servers are trash. I've never played a game with such inconsistency in lag and rubberbanding (for such a high precision endeavor). These are the two reasons I'll go from a "flow" to just turning the game off for a day or two.All in all well worth it whether for just causal fun to some of the most competitve gaming you'll ever come across.
title: Rocket League®

review: Hot Wheels is a brand of 1 64 1 43 1 18 and 1 50 scale die cast toy cars introduced by American toy maker Mattel in 1968. It was the primary competitor of Matchbox until 1997 when Mattel bought Tyco Toys then owner of Matchbox.Many automobile manufacturers have since licensed Hot Wheels to make scale models of their cars allowing the use of original design blueprints and detailing. Although Hot Wheels were originally intended for children and young adults they have become popular with adult collectors for whom limited edition models are now made available.A picture of the rear of Hot Wheels toy car packaging from 2018. This toy car has been packaged in a "Short Card" style which is used by grocery stores and other retailers who do not usually stock toys and do not have large toy display areas. This particular packaging is produced for sale outside of the United States ("International") because it has multiple languages printed on the back rather than only English. Thus it is said to be packaged in "International Short Card packaging".The toy car itself is a model of a real life motor vehicle in this case a 1955 Corvette Convertible. Note the code ("FKB19") at the top of the package this identifies the exact model of toy car within the packaging.In 2018 Hot Wheels celebrated the making of its four billionth car with the production of a diamond studded model worth US$140 000. It had 2700 diamond chips a total of almost 23 karats and was cast in white gold with rubies serving as taillights. 2 Contents1 History1.1 19681.2 Racing track set1.3 19691.4 1970s1.5 1977 1988 The 'Blackwalls' era1.6 1989 1994 The collector number era1.7 1995 1999 The Treasure Hunt era1.8 2000s1.9 20031.10 20041.11 20051.12 2007 and 20081.13 2009 and 20101.14 20111.15 20121.16 20131.17 20141.18 20151.19 20162 The "Sweet 16"3 Collectors3.1 Dates on cars4 Hot Wheels Classics5 Special model lines5.1 Made by other companies5.2 Hot Wheels Elite and Hot Wheels Mattel5.3 Car Culture6 Treasure Hunt series7 Live action film project8 Sizzlers9 Promotion and sponsorships9.1 Motorsports9.2 Video games10 References11 External linkshttps //en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hot_Wheels

review: TL DR RL is an excellent game but it has shoddy servers that can ruin the experience unexpectedly.I've been playing RL for quite a long time and I really freaking love this game. It's just so simple clean and refined while at the same time being incredibly complex and nuanced. There is so much to love about this game but there is also so much to hate. Specifically the state of the RL servers. Sometimes the game plays perfectly without any sort of lag or issues but there are times there are many many times where the servers are all just bad. And the connection issues aren't client side. For reference my gaming rig has a GTX 1070 and an AMD FX 8350 so it's not a slow rig. It can run practically any game at max graphics with a smooth 60 144fps. And my internet averages at about 20 ping 130Mbps download when on wifi and &lt 5 ping 210Mbps download on ethernet. Even with these specs and on medium low traffic days on RL (less than 100 000 online) I still have consequetive matches with constant lag rubber banding ghosting etc. The game should not look like this https //www.youtube.com/watch?v n4LeReKlpTs (Thanks to Dragonking_Gaming who put an example on youtube so when I searched "rocket league bad connection" I got exactly what i wanted).And I'm a relatively patient person. I realise there are all kinds of ridiculous stuff that developers and tech teams deal with. I'm certainly not one to rage at a single mistake. It's more that I've been playing this game for a few years and especially recently everything seems to be getting worse not better. In recent months and several past updates I've more consistently had very poor experiences with RL due to poor connection. It shouldn't be this way and it's almost strictly up to luck whether or not I will enjoy playing RL every time I launch it. Bad servers aside I still love this game. I have a few nitpicks with the garbage AI and the unbalanced matchmaking but the game itself is amazing. There are very few games these days that will really pull me in and just immerse me with the gameplay. I think that RL is approachable by everyone and fun even for newcomers but it also has immense depth for those who want to become masters. That right there is a quality of a good game.I should probably also mention that in my 300+ hours of experience I find that the community is more often friendly than not. Don't get me wrong there have been plenty of experiences dealing with toxic players. But I have made way more friends on RL than I have enemies and people are generally more open to being friendly than rude.
title: Rocket League®

review: This is about the 5th time I've changed this review and gone from UP to DOWN and back UP again.I'll keep it short this time.This game is tons of fun and totally unique. It's one of those games that you just have to try.The downsides come and go and there is still lots of room for improvement. The company doesn't seem keen on moving real fast with game fixes and enhancements but they do happen eventually. Their strongest suit is just adding content to the game.Bottom line is there are downsides but it's well worth trying. Just look at how many hours I have in and you'll know that no matter how much there is that I dislike there's more of it to like.

review: LOVE THE GAME BUT THE NEW SCORING SYSTEM IS ABSOLUTELY DUMBI love rocket league so much fun never gets old the games are intense and just crazy. Teammates can be a real buzz kill real fast but everyone has bad games and whatnot. Only things I can complain about is the new scoring system is absolutely I see no reason why they even would change it and at that not for the better. My own opinion though someone else might like it better but I cant imagine why. They really need to add the cross platform party system seems more important to me than a new scoring system to an already established game but im sure they have their reasons.Rocket Pass has cool rewards but seems slow to tier up. Everyones copying fortnite with this "Pass" bs... let it end.I feel the Competitive ranking system could be improved for sure slow leveling up and it doesnt matter how well you play if you lose you almost always rank down. If your teammate totally goes full tard and gives them the game your screwed..MVP shouldnt be reserved for the winning team only... most points is most points.Would be cool to see a some bigger maps for standard and chaos for sure.Also lately I have noticed a lot of saves and clear balls that arent giving points on both teams. Still I tell anyone who plays video games to buy this game and play it all the time on xbox and steam.** Would be awesome to be able to link the accounts and just have 1 level to go off ** And possibly the inventory ??

review: Edit after a few updates have occured this game is now unplayable for me i have constant packet loss which in turn sends my car flying and skipping across the screen at random I have searched everywhere for a fix but there seems to be only fingers pointed at isp which is not the case as they have been to my home multiple times as i am trying to resolve this issue it is only this game that is haveing network issues for me out of about 50 online games that i play on this pc. fix this issue and ill give 10/10Put simply i havent enjoyed a game this much since mario kart. every single game is a different experience every course unique every encounter special. i will probably spend hundreds of hours on this game in the future. i like to play a few games a night before getting into anything intense or sometimes after i get mad at a different game this game will bring joy into your life also a joy to watch the kids play if you have any.
title: Rocket League®

review: Pros Easy to learnVery replayableStreamlined gameplayMultiplayerCommunity covers all skill and experience levelsCross platform capableAesthetic customization all over the placeCreative mechanicsActive developersCons Hard to masterThis game will take up too much time in your lifeNothing else reallyPersonal Preferences Sports gameLoot boxes are a thing as of 2018Personal Opinion This game is simple in theory but complicated in practice. Playing football (soccer) with a rocket powered car is not as easy as it would seem yet this game has grabbed my attention from the beginning. I have loved every hour that I have played. I strongly reccomend this game to people who are looking to just have a great time with their friends. The only thing I personally dislike about this game (and yes I know this is picky because this capability would be really difiicult to develop) is the fact that cross platform partying is not an available feature. I'm not close to being a sports fan but I still love this game. This game remains one of my all time favorites.10/10
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a car football game where 2 teams of 3 players have to score the most goals for their team to win. A unique project that I've never seen perfected before.Rocket League has 3 types of game modes Competitive Casual and Extra Modes (AKA the fun ones ). Competitive and Casual have the same 4 side modes 1v1 2v2 3v3 and 4v4 while Extra Modes has Rumble Dropshot Hoops Snow Day and Training. I usually play Competitive 3v3 and the experience I have for it is positive while I have met a few toxic people on my journey I've also met some awesome players that I loved to play with.The game also has an Elo like ranking system. You win a few games you go up a rank or division you lose some you drank. I myself play the game to go up the ranks even though I'm still on Silver I still have a great experience playing the game at those low ranks.One big part of Rocket League is the vehicle customization you can put hats flags custom skins or even change your car. I find this part of the game very nice because I love customization in games. By the way my favourite car is the default Octane.One mentionable thing is the main menu Official SoundTrack It has this techno sound and I like it. My favourite song being Mike Ault x Christian de la Torre Darkness.Anyways from a scale from 0 10 How much would I recommend this game? I would recommend this game a solid 9 out of 10. One of the best car games on the market.
title: Rocket League®

review: This used to be such a nice relaxing game to play. I really enjoyed it on PS4 and when I first got it on PC. Then Psyonix decided to "update" the game.This game has one of the most toxic communities I have seen. The servers are extremely unstable and unreliable. Definitely worst servers on any game.Matchmaking is unfair and pathetic. Players can hit the ball while being so far from it. Random ping spikes when my internet is perfectly stable prove how pathetic the servers are.My internet is perfectly stable and my PC is good especially compared to the recommended requirements.If you want to play this game casually get it when it's on special. Else don't waste your money.I still enjoy the game but will stand my negative review based not on a bad community but because of the server performance and matchmaking.2015 2016 9/102017 8/102018 2.5/10

review: Very fun game definitely worth buying and one of the best/most enjoyable video games I've ever played! (And I tell you this isn't just a few games ahah I've played lots of good stuff and others that were complete trash)+Learning aspect of RL is huge it will take a while to master +Replayability is there any game that could be more re playable than this one? I think not +It's creative it's extremely enjoyable and fun to play even better with friends +Competitive scene is there with ranked mode this game definitely takes practice and skill to win and I tell you it is not that easy +Developers listen to the community and provide small updates/fixes once in a while +Definitely not pay to win since you can only buy cosmetic stuff which is what modern gaming is about and is becoming more and more nowadays in terms of micro transactions keys for the crates are pretty cheap actually compared to CSGO PUBG H1Z1 and the likes +Managed to put trademarked popular car brands in the game which is quite nice for the fans +Amazing with friends you will have a good time be it competive or casual! Toxic community salty players Sometimes the game lags and you miss the ball that's kinda lame. It doesn't happen as often as you might think though This game is so fun and I like it so much that I got two different aAdvice Fan of cars and soccer? Like creativity and probably just want to enjoy something different to rest from your "main" video game? DEFINITELY buy this. Also are you competitive? This is way much more competitive than most competitive games nowadays. FUN AF!

review: Ranking system sucks. Can't even stay as a group in competitive. So you're forced to play with different players who have different play styles meanwhile you go up against people in partys who either suck as a team or more often play well. I was at Plat IV but now I'm back to Plat II literally within a hour (been in Plat for a few months). Either allow the players to chose if they want to go up against a team in a party or set up a "Stay as a group" option which people has been asking for a year or two ago. So we don't have to constantly get paired with a bad mix of play styles.Like how your team played stay as a group. If not then rework the ranking system.Strongly don't recommend this game until the devs add more options other needed fixes and maps. Also fix the damn ball/collision especially in Rumble. Went to hit the ball that's not even going fast and nothing happens my car gets pushed back instead allowing the other team to make a score.

review: Its Finally time for me to leave a review on this game. After countless hours ungodly amounts of practice and some of the highest lows imagineable I think i've gotten a grasp of some of the game. Whats there to say about Rocket League other than there is no game out there like it. The graphics are appealing to look at and the mecahnics are smooth and rewarding with a little practice. The skill gap is almost limitless while the game is still fun for the people with negative 5 hours in the game. Whether you know what you're doing or not Rocket League is a blast and I highly reccomend the game. Ever since bronze of season one ive been enthralled by this game and have been on the endless climb to reach the top. Ranked matchmaking is probably one of the biggest turn ons of this game. You get the satisfying thrill of climbing ranks with a team/randoms that is generally only rewarded by Mobas. What's the catch? Matches are 5 minutes you're in out and ready to go again. And boy are those five minutes filled with great moments toxic players and an experience that will make you throw your computer down stairs. I've managed to solo queue my way to grand champ a few times and have been on and off the game for the past 4 years and let me tell you this community is trash. But they're lovable trash all the same. Ive had days where i lose 15 ranks and days where I gain them all back. One season i was champ 3 and didnt get out of Diamond three for 5 months. The competetive aspect and reward for all that grind keeps me coming back. Learning tech is so rewarding and hitting those goals gives you a feeling like no other. So yeah Rocket League is a great game that anyone can pick up and have fun. The competetive scene is ever growing and players/streamers are extremely helpful and plentiful. Ive made so many friends thanks to Rocket League and became apart of a great Community. And man the FREEPLAY is so ing good in between matches. But no game is without its flaws so lets talk about some stuff.PsionixMan Psionix really messes with me sometimes. I cant understand their motives nor do i think they actually care about this game. Patches constantly break the game. FPS is horrendous on some mid/low end PCS. Optimization doesnt really exist. The servers are getting worse and worse with each year. Psionix please fix the servers. I cant count how many games of US east i load into where my ping is less than 90. Wanna play with your friends in Europe? I used to get a solid 111 ping or less now its up to 200 min. God forbid your mate living in Australia. Constant DC's or server issues plague games and there's nothing that can be done about it. Wanna talk about the crashes? Well the game randomly crashes on game startup sometimes. The menus have been loading slower and slower with each update. Sometimes my RL loader crashes. Sometimes it takes 7 minutes for it to load RL. The controller detection is absolute garbage. Instead or rolling out optimization or getting better services sometimes it feels Rocket League is just rolling out more crates to fatten the pockets of the owners. Why aren't there more tournaments? There are so many good teams and it feels as if there is only three tournaments all year. Rocket League is growing at a rapid pace and it feels as if Psionix keeps pushing the players away and making it a major annoyance to play the game.But don't let the nagatives startle you I love the game and will continue playing it. And honestly so should you
title: Rocket League®

review: Приветствую! Сегодня я напишу свой обзор на игру Rocket League .Rocket League это спортивная аркада которая затягивает с первого гола.Rocket League вышла в 2015 году и создала этот продукт компания Psyonix rocket League вышла на PC PS4 XBOX ONE.В rocket League можно играть на клавиатуре так и на геймпаде.(легче играть с геймпада).Атмосфера в игре просто восхитительна! В игре есть много режимов плюшек машин и.т.д.Так же 8 сентября вышло очень долгожданное обновление разработчики добавили кейсы машины колёса окраски бусты.2016 год очень порадовал ибо разработчики не забрасывают а улучшают всё лучше и лучше саму игру.И так начнём с хоккея в игре он присутствует очень добротно и красиво.Баскетбол был добавлен в апреле 2016 года в который сложно играть но режим довольно изумительный.Рокот был добавлен вместе с вещами для тюнинга машины сам режим очень угарный вантус просто тащит как и борцовская перчатка.И кстати в игре можно обмениваться разными вещами например машины.Тюнинг в игре очень большой много чего можно установить на машину шапку нитро колёса и.т.д.Так же вам могут выпасть цветные колёса они очень хорошо ценятся смотря какие только.В игре есть кейсы и их можно открыть в чём минус они редко выпадают может кому они каждую игру выпадают но лично мне падают редко есть 3 кейса кейс чемпионов 1 2 3 в них есть машины красного качества так и колёса экзотические и.т.д.Забыл о самом главном это мм(соревновательный режим) там вы сможете поднять себе ранг в соревновательном режиме можно играть один на один два на два три на три (увлекательно катать мм с другом очень необыкновенное ощущение мой максимальный ранг(challenger 1.)Всегда любил рокет лигу люблю и буду любить.Эта игра затянула меня с первого захода всем рекомендую rocket League запала мне в душу и стала самой любимой игрой.
title: Rocket League®

review: Just to start off I've played for way more than the hours stated here on both PS4 and switch prior to recieving it on my PC. I am amazingly surprised with how decently well the game runs on my PC. Here's some of my specs to legitimize my statement (try not to laugh) Processor Intel Core i3 4030U 1.90GHzRAM 6GBGraphics Intel HD Graphics 4400Nonetheless after some tweaking the game runs at a fairly decent quality equilavent to my switch. There's some occasional input lag but nothing out of this world. Internet speeds make up for that. So props to the developers for making it work on old potato laptops.Moving on the game itself is top notch. It remains to be one of the few MP games I still consistently play as all the other games I was into have pushed me towards quitting due to the lack of fun arising from the excessive toxicity (RL can be toxic but IMO it doesn't reach CoD or GTA levels) and skill desparities between teams made up of parties of no lifers and random teams of kids who barely know how to aim and shoot. Meanwhile RL's competitive matchmaking attempts to cuts off that desparity by teaming you up with players who at least somewhat match your skills even if they prove to be "trash" during one match. And if you really hated your team's chemistry no worries odds are you will match make with a new set of teammates. Something that doesn't happen with the other games unless you are doing ranked following specific esports guidelines of gameplay which takes away most of the fun of casuals.As for the gameplay mechanics there's a lot that could be said about this but I would say that the fact that so much precision and accuracy goes into scoring a goal shows that a lot of extra work was put into finecrafting a unique sports racing game with unique mechanics that emulates real world soccer/football in a fun fast paced way while maintaining its existing rules.So if you like cars/racing and also like sports and want a chill game to play either casually or competitively without collapsing of a heart attack caused by stress of tilted toxic gameplay then rocket league is for you. Yes you will suck at first and yes you will blame teammates for your Ls but always remember you can or could be the problem (even if you were MVP).
title: Rocket League®

review: I initially got this game at the request of a friend so I had no idea what to expect. I think the concept is unique and I'm a fan of the cosmetics you can earn. The singleplayer "Season" experience was pretty boring but that's fine with me because 99% of the time I play multiplayer anyways. I'm not a fan of the idea that you have to purchase keys to unlock crates or purchase dlc to unlock cars but I the game can still be played successfully without those transactions. Additionally the multiplayer community.....oof....its pretty.....toxic. Overall there's a handful of negative aspects about this game but for the most part its pretty fun plus matches don't last that long so you can definitely pick up this game for a match or two if you don't have a lot of time.
title: Rocket League®

review: Easy to learn impossible to master. Such a cool concept when first starting out. Very satisfying once new moves have been mastered. More fun with friends. My only complaint is that quality of life things take some time to come around or are never released. Cross platform play seemed like it took way too long and we still don't have the ability to Steam invite using only a controller. Yes you can use big picture mode but you would think they would do something that simple at some point.

review: After over 1000 hours of playtime I sometimes still can't wait to get home and hop on this game. It's truly an addicting game one that is it's own genre. If you think you might not like this game think again. There is no defining something like Rocket League. It has a sizeable esports scene and is just straight up fun for the more casual players as well. Since it came out in 2015 professional players still haven't reached the skill ceiling or even come close. I used to think "how much skill and strategy can be involved in a game about a bunch of cars hitting a ball around?" As it turns out the game has a huge learning curve. This doesn't mean that it's too difficult for new players but rather that it's all the harder to master the mechanics. And there are ALOT of them.

review: My most played game. As you climb you start to learn how much you suck but the multiplayer games match are decent at matching you with someone who will challenge so you will incrementally get better at the game.For the most part the community is okay. Like any online competitive game you get the toxic teammates(that are probably losing because they are throwing not because you suck like they claim). Even if you are having problems with that they offer a 1v1 competitve mode that will let you fine tune your mechanics of the game. The replay value is high. I don't have as much time as I'd like to invest in games these days since I work a lot more so this one is definitely a good 'pick up and play anytime' type of game.
