Morning lunch break at night. I train myself I warmp up I go into ranked games. Every single day. Crazy thing about this i'm still years from mastering the game but i get better every day. When i'm not playing i'm watching videos and blogs about how to perfect skills and mechanics. For a non gamer this tell how good this game is. Buy this every one should be playing this.

review: Can't play without horrendous lag. Warps my car across the map. I go for the ball the ball warps across the map. I have a wired 40 mbps connection and exceed all system requirements. Unplayable if you want to play competitive. I have thousands of hours in the game on other platforms and never had these problems (until recently on the Switch and PC). Haven't tried lately on XBOne but I'm tired of paying monthly fees to play online so I probably won't.I actually really like this game. It's a fun concept. Right now I can't recommend it for more than letting your kids or nieces/nephews drive around and hit the ball on local coop.

review: I first started playing Rocket League a year or two ago on the PS4 when it was free and instantly fell in love with it. Moving forward to now and finally having built a beast of a gaming PC I just had to buy RL and play it on PC.If you love driving tiny cars playing indoor soccer/football and blowing stuff up then this game is certainly for you.Yes at first it is challenging and there is a learning curve which isn't too steep but not long after doing some in game training and practice you'll be ready for some insane multiplayer fun online or locally with friends.Advancing on in the game with your skills increasing you will meet other more challenging rivals but that adds to the fun.This game has gained huge momentum and is an official E Sport.I highly recommend Rocket League to anyone who has a level of coordination and loves the concept of indoor soccer/football with cars.

review: As of 5 Jan 2019 I still dont recommend this game. If you like people scolding you if you make a mistake other than csgo this game is perfect for you. MMMMM sure do love the thrill of people telling me im bad!!!!The game itself is great and all of the game modes are fine (except for dropshot which has some bugs relating to how the ball bounces on the ground (making you whiff when you shouldn't have)). So why am i not recommending this? Well it's just the community that isn't "fine". Some of the times obviously you will get really good games but most of the times the games you play will leave you ticked off.I recommend you find some friends to play this game with. Randoms are too.. well random. With friends you'll know what they are going to do (playstyles) so you'll position yourself better and have a more powerful team. (A good plat team can beat a bad diamond team)If it's your first time playing.. Have fun in bronze while it lasts. You'll sooner or later be in the upper ranks and you'll soon realise what the community really is. I also recommend you to check out the workshop maps. They are really fun.

If a hypotetical Rocket League 2 were to release and have the exact same monetization schemes as this game I wouldnt even consider it for a second hard pass. Psyonix gets away with it here because this game is well loved and a couple years old.

review: A "STAIGHT TO THE POINT" REVIEWThis game is fun. It's 3rd person. Imagine you could do all those tricks you did with Hot Wheels cars as a kid. But now there is a ball. It goes into a goal.Yeah that's it. Oh and you must not break Rule 1. Google is your friend on this one.Pros Unique competitive game that already has a huge following both casually and professionally. No paid unlockables that aren't cosmetic everyone has an equal chance of being good at the game. Psyonix is pretty responsive and level minded studio most players seem to agree with their choices. Good optimization most non potatoes can run this game.Cons I honestly don't have any.

review: The game is VERY fun will never deny that. The main problem as with pretty much every single online game is the community is full of very toxic people who care about nothing but points. And no I do not mean the goal points.There is a goal point system for each match similar to that of soccer. When you score a goal your team gets a point and the team with the most points at the end of a match wins. But there is also an individual point system for each player and it is not done very good and the majority of the community seems to use it as a means to trash talk and it also screws over matches with randoms who just want those points because they feel it makes them look good. For starters the point system incetivises players to do nothing but go for the ball and that is exactly what many players do. They try as often as they can to simply touch the ball even it if means screwing over your own team. It also is very hard to get points without doing things like scoring goals or putting the ball in the direction of the goal meaning if you are playing a goalie have fun getting talked down to because you have a high chance of getting very few points and people will often even screw you over at actually being a goalie because they just want those sweet sweet points.
title: Rocket League®

review: A few thoughts on Rocket League 1) Lots of fun to play casually or competitively. I personally don't play video games too often anymore but this is always a fun one to hop on if I have some time to kill.2) The mechanics of the game are pretty tricky. There's certainly a significant curve to the gameplay experience so you can keep learning and improving in the long run however it's fun and simple enough to get started.3) Whether you're looking for a competitive game to really learn and develop in or you're just looking for a fun and casual pass time this is the one provided of course that cars and football are your thing.4) Micro transactions are tastefully implemented here imo
title: Rocket League®

review: Alright so ima start this off saying that this game might have the most replay value in a game that I have seen in a while not including The Binding of Isaac Rebirth which is another good game. This game has a HUGE learning curve which is why I would recommend playing 3v3 with bots. It can easily make you better. This game to be fair is amazing it s fun and can also be frustrating. When you first start it you are going to be hot garbage. After spending some time you might actually be able to hit low aerials after tryharding for 20 hours straight you are a god. After dumping your girlfriend and locking yourself in your room and isolating yourself for 48 hours straight and the only food you eat are lunchables and you drink lemonade you become thanos anyone who is below you will suffer greatly and you can now 720 backflip double barrel roll (even though that s not in the game) and then fuus ro da the ball into the net. You get 50+ goals a game now. In all seriousness this game is truly amazing and I recommend it to everyone.

review: I'm changing my review to negative for what this game has become STUPID DEVELOPERS made everything wrong. I've been offended thousands of times with racists slangs (macaco monkey the n word etc) homophobic slangs (f word etc) but if I offend back I get banned but the racists never get banned. Just shows how psyonix doesn't give a about racism but ban you for saying words like the a word. It's pathetic really. They don't ban trolls either never seen a single troll getting banned. I myself trolled many times people who deserved it but I only got banned when I offended someone (never without reason btw). A pity these terrible developers are only interested in what is happening at game chat which is meaningless since you can just mute everyone than what's actually happening INGAME. As if this wasn't enough now you can't play some modes on casual you HAVE to play them ranked (basketball rocket labs hockey etc). And even more you can't put them together with "normal modes" 3v3 or 4v4 you have to select one "mode" to play online which is ridiculous because I love especially to play 3v3 and 4v4 but now I have to choose the modes to play the "normal" game or the "special" modes. Seriously this game was very fun when it was released and the new modes were being released but what the developers have made with this game is absolutely unforgivable. Not to mention they are cowards who closed Steam Discussion because they can't handle critics. 5 years they could develop tools to ban people who swear on chat but you can't make a decent bot. SHAME on you Psyonix.

review: Rocket League is fun to play since the beginning but getting better increases the joy to play it even more. Being able to hit the ball precisely on the ground or up in the air allows you to combine skill with creativity to score incredible goals. Getting there will take you a few hundreds of hours tho. On the way you can look forward to score amazing goals every now and then by pressing buttons in panic and maneuvering the ball into your or the enemy teams goal without any understanding how you've even hit it. These goals as other situations usually come with a burst of preprogrammed sarcastic Messages trying to hit you hard but mostly make you wipe a tear of joy. When your team is a few goals behind it pays off to keep a cool head and lead your team to victory.. or blame your teammates for being noobs as you gaze on the scoreboard to see you being MVP of your team with solid 10 points ahead and ragequit as soon as the enemy team shoots the next ball into your undefended net. Thanks to the fact that most players steer via controller and don't have a keyboard in range the community is much less salty than League of Legends. I love this game.

review: I'll start with the cons first I have 300+ hours on Xbox i'm a Platinum/Diamond but i can take some Champions rather regularly. (I'm not the best but i'm not the worst either). &gt Cons Horrible servers even when you're in your region you'll get latency and packet loss issues with low ping. Teleporting all around the map and passing right through the ball are common events. (On a serious side note Psyonix NEEDS to fix the servers. Solo queueing ranked is the definition of frustration. I cannot count how many times i've queued 2v2 and 10secs into the match it's a 1v2 because my teammate lost connection). High levels of toxicity. Salty arrogant racist sexist people everywhere... maybe that's what happens when you give players the ability to talk to eachother in a game. Voice and text chat disabling are available (for me a must have). Teammates will leave the match after 1 goal is scored on you sometimes even if it's in the first 10 seconds of a 5min match. People will tryhard and flame you in casual even more in ranked (usually because you missed a "easy" ball but they also miss a similar shot. So the best strategy is to not give them any "ammo" just don t reply no argument you have with them will have a fruitful outcome). Currently exists a glitch where a player will suddenly disconnect from a ranked match. Sometimes they won t connect anymore and you ll have 1 teammate. &gt Pros Fun to play with friends. Having Discord can really help by knowing which one will engage at each time or some juicy passing plays. Playing solo in ranked can be very challenging. With no communication things can go bad so don't stress it out too much ("it's only game why you have to be mad" are some wise words). Remember tilt and anger are also factors for quality of gameplay. So if you're mad about something just stop playing take a break. High level of customization from the start. Hundreds of itens some dropped after a match others from crates. You can also download a modding tool called "Alpha Console" which grants you client sided itens for you to customize you car. Like the marvelous "Alpha boost". Fun game modes like Hoops (basket ball) Rumble and "mutators" in private matches which can give the ball more bounciness make it a square. It can give you more strength to hit the ball or make your boost unlimited... etc.

review: This is the funnest game I've ever played. The skill cap is super high but even beginners can have a great time playing. 5 minute maches make the game easy to play for a short time if that's all you have. And who wouldn't like flying car soccer? 10/102019 EDIT The servers are still garbage. There was a developer message over a year ago talking about the state of servers and how they are working on it and they keep getting worse and worse. Apparently the "packet loss" is on "my end" and I'm supposed to troubleshoot it? But it was effecting 3/4 players in the lobby causing me to lose points because I couldn't see where anything was going due to the fact that their servers are absolute trash. I wouldn't care about the points if it was a one off issue but servers are getting worse and worse as time goes on and it seem that nothing has been done to fix them. I've run into an abundance of terrible servers in my time which has resulted in a lot of points lost without cause or won without being deserved. I love this game and probably always will but until the servers get better my review is being changed to a thumbs down.
title: Rocket League®

review: After coming back to this game I have not had a good experience. The game itself is fun but the players are really toxic at times. I've seen the opposing team forfeit almost immediately after my team scores a goal or players just leaving. Sarcasm is just built into the game with the quick chat and when players actually use the text chat it's not in a good way.There are games where all the players just hate on one individual and it just ruins the game play for me. I'm taking the advice of some players I've encountered in a game who told me "that u actualy fkin suck" and "yeah fr just uninstall". Clearly their skill level and experience with the game was much more advanced than my own so it was in the best interests of the community that I uninstall the game yet again. I am amazed though that no one has advised me to remove the game license from my steam account but it is something that I am considering in the future.At times I felt quite depressed but then I would do things that I loved and find enjoyment out of doing them. Then I would play a game of Rocket League and feel depressed from a virtual game that didn't matter. The ridiculous nature of this cycle is actually quite pathetic and was also a major influence in my decision to waste my time to write this review about a game I seemingly didn't care about yet spent nearly 500 hours playing.In my short return to the game I played mostly ranked games in the middle of the ranked ladder where most of the player base probably is so you can just treat me as one of those salty players.
title: Rocket League®

review: It is obviously an amazing game and the new updates and gamemodes are always fantastic but I still have 2 huge problems.1.)This game is one of the few that allows for cross platform players playing together. I love this bonus but one problem is that you cant talk to player across other platforms besides for the quick chat. This bothers me because It really takes the stratagy out of higher level gameplay and can bring your team to a big disadvantage. You cant tell them to "stay in goal" or "move to mid" or any useful communications.2.)Doubles... Its my favorite gamemode but sometimes the most irritating. I always find myself with a ball chasing noob who pulls down my rank or a freestyle god who scores 19 goals. This isnt a problem but when you find yourself with a teamate who starts shooting own goals and bumping into you the whole game it gets frusturating and when there is no good way to report them or get them to stop you have a problem. i think they need to add more easily found mods and a more aggressive reportr systemIn conclusion this is a great game with so many addicting aspects but it still does have its flaws. I would recommend this game to anyone.

review: An insanely addicting game with wonderfully solid and fluid mechanics that keep you coming back for more. All in all you get to play a mix of car hockey and football in a random arena with a battle car of your choice with up to 3 teammates (if you wish). There are several game modes to choose from ranging from your basic Soccar to Hoops to Hockey to even power up enabled mode with multiple vertical levels in the arena (also known as Rumble) and more.Devs keep adding new events and game modes regularly along with new cosmetics and vehicles. Players keep discovering new things they can do with their cars and by using the arena coming up with new ways to get an edge over their opponents. There is a skill curve but it is quite generous due to it being an arcade game and there are separate casual and competitive matchmaking queues to help decide your speed of play.The community is generally helpful though like every multiplayer game you will run into a few bad eggs. The important thing is to not let them sour your taste of the game.
title: Rocket League®

review: Started out as a lot of fun. Plenty of laughs. Then we started playing online...It's not fun getting matchups against Championship level players when you're just no where near good enough to even have a shot playing against them. The game keeps matching you up against the same people perpetually unless you exit. So match after match you can get your butt kicked by the same insanely good player.Psyonix how about this as a threshold people that can sink shots while flying (consistently) should not be pitted against those that cannot yet PERIOD!The other gripe I have is the "no XP awarded" threshold. If you don't score at least 50 points you won't get XP even if your team wins. Except that effort doesn't generate points. You can work your butt off and be a part of the game and not get enough points. This is pretty frustrating. Especially when you get 48 points and lose out. I know they are trying to deal with the bot problem using this threshold. But I think they need to get a bit more creative with how they determine player participation!The training needs some serious expansion. While there's an airshots training mode. The game never actually teaches you how to FLY your car. You're basically expected to figure that out on your own! Or how to dribble even? The training section really needs to be beefed up with some basic how to and more drills. Striker training should let you do saves repeatedly (if you want) and keep a percentage of shots and misses rather than a silly 10 and done.Complaints aside this game can be a lot of fun.

review: Rocket League is an amazing take on the soccer genre. It is a nice combination that can appeal to car enthusiast and soccer fans alike. Great game to play with freinds but if you are looking for cross platforms your options are very limited. You can make a private lobby and play with you freinds on other consoles but thats about it. The controls are pretty simple to start but how they get implemented is what seperates the tiers in competitive. The learning curve isn't that bad with flying being the first main goal but progess is made steadily with time. Matches are short and fun so you won't be making any sort of 1hr long commitment to play this game unless you find it too hard to log off.

review: What can I possibly say about Rocket League? The mechanics are there the uniqueness of it but that's all there is to it... and the satisfaction of scoring a ceiling shot or pulling off a nasty air dribble OOOOOH MANAs good as the game might be if the community sucks the experience would be the same as if the game is an utter pile of trash and RL is a perfect example of that... and no I am not talking about the toxic players but I object to the converse side of the community namely the "chill" community. Anyone with +100 hours on the game will KNOW how it feels to get matched with bad teammates I mean everyone has gotten through this experience of raging over his mate for basically not doing anything besides flopping around with his scarab octane...Now you got the chance to rage in the chat and what will be the two responses that you most likely get? Either that you are crying or they will just spam your out for being toxic as hell. And then what do they do they intentionally or not intentionally less apt for the later play worse for the sake of it. And if you persist they will spam over and over until you get sick of it and you either leave end up muting the players or at worst take a hiatus from the game because you lost sense of enjoyment out of it...What I am trying to say is that the "majority" as they like to call themselves of the community will immediately without hesitation spam words such as toxic and flammer and the word that frustrates me the most cry seriously tho having a point to complain about and crying isn't the same damn thing without any true meaning until you are completely done for. Those people don't think as of why that would happen and hence they never get better at the game nor learn from their mistakes hence leaving room for more complaints from ensuing teammates they might get matched with. I get it many people can't help themselves and might get out of hand and plainly too difficult to deal with but when people are angry do we try to feel some empathy and improve upon both them and ourselves or we try to completely destroy them and leave no desire to be found in the game from their new view a game full of people that just don't understand that for once they might be the problem and not continuously blame the "toxic" players for ruining the game because in reality you are the one ruining the experience of the game. No one wins that way...If you are one of those people The people who call at first sight everyone that critisizes them to be a "toxic" player don't do anything and lose the game then calling yourself "chill" as an excuse of your most likely poor performance you think about all this deeply because you might be the hindrance of the community and not the others ( That's all there is to Rocket League the first and only game that to my eyes shows that the "toxic" community might be a tad bit smarter and more dilligent in the sense of self improving and blaming mates when they have poor performance than the "chill" community that just sputters "toxic" and "flammer" by heart. I will end this here...

review: In this review i'm going to focus just on the game experience itself. I'm going to skip anything related to the crates and all that because it's all optional and doesn't really impact your in game experience.Rocket League can simply be explained in two words...Fun but BROKEN.As much as i do enjoy this game i hate it as well mainly the rank system and matchmaking....ooooh boy the matchmaking in ranked is just trash especially in solo queueing Now imagine you got to a certain rank in Standard which is just normal 3v3 match..say you're gold 1 division 3. Thanks to the matchmaking system that TOTALLY makes sense there is a chance that you'll get matched up against a team of 2 gold 2's and a gold 3...Why does this happen ? who knows really.There is a bunch of connection/server issues and loads and loads of people suffer from really bad ping even with the most stable connection you can possibly have. Trust me it's immensly frustrating getting disconnected mid ranked match and not being able to rejoin just because the servers are so broken. Oh and i nearly forgot that yes..you'll still get banned from match making for 5 minuts (5 more for every match left/disconnected from) which is just so much fun.Don't get me wrong it's a fun game. It's fun learning the new mechanics and trying to implement them in your playstyle to try and outplay your opponents and if you have some skilled friends you can get some really nutty plays going!The physics are really solid (although sometimes a bit janky but that's a pretty rare occurance) and you don't need an absolute beast of a PC to be able to play it.Now would i recommend this game ? Sure why not...if you enjoy skillbased games than this is certainly a great game to learn how to play. Plus if you can get your friends to play it with you that's even better. BUT just be sure that you'll get tilted...A LOTYes i am going to recommend this game but seriously...psyonix please PLEASE make the game/server connections more stable and fix the ban/report systems too.Also why do players have to get punished for getting disconnected ? it just doesn't make sense.

title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a incredibly fine tuned and skill based game. Don't worry about RNG ruining your experience because it literally doesn't exist in Rocket League. Additionally Rocket League is very rewarding to those who dedicate their time to furthering their skills. There are tons of mechanics to learn besides jumping flipping and boosting. Every single mechanic has community made training packs which you can complete. The diversity to the game's mechanics are what make it so phenomenal. On the kickoff alone you could boost straight boost and then front flip boost for a while then turn slightly to one direction and side flip boost and jump once and then front flip just above the ground to get a speed boost without actually flipping or yolo it by boosting and turning your car 180 degrees midair before backflipping. Whatever style you want to utilize this game offers it. Buy this game it is more than worth your time.
title: Rocket League®

review: Easily one of the best games I have ever played. The game is so clean and fun with little to no glitches or bugs that ruin the experience. With the intense competitive play and the devs constantly adding items and events to this game it stays fresh and fun for hundreds and hundreds of hours.
title: Rocket League®

review: Steam shows 100 hrs of gameplay but I played on Xbox for 3 years prior.This game used to be fun but it just seems kinda blah now.Suffers from a broken matchmaking system. Most matches are extremely unbalanced especially in ranked play where it matters most. Not really that fun when the other team is capable of performing ariels and trick shots while it's all your teammates can do to hold a basic rotation. This is probably my biggest complaint.I also feel like the community is shrinking even with the crossplay updates. Usually I just end up playing with the same 2 3 people at time. Even after requeing.I'd still recommend it to new players but only when it's on a discount. (Highly recommended you play with friends though)
title: Rocket League®

Granted it took a LONG time and every once and a while it won't work/
